Reviews.Title: “Staff made me feel like family”
Reviews.Author: olowo s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in an upgraded room. We had access to the Club Lounge wich was very relaxing. This is one of the best club lounges I have been in, and the staff throughout this hotel were excellent especially vinayak and gurdeep. The room was comfortable, the food we took very nice, and there is nothing to dislike about this hotel. Being almost on the station concourse is a boon for train travellers arriving into London, or departing. It is probably our favourite hotel in it’s class in the capital.

Reviews.Title: “What the business traveller needs”
Reviews.Author: chutaiko
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It's a short walk from Paddington Station, those business travelers who use the Paddington Express know how valuable that location is. All the amenities are included even Breakfast and Internet. Another plus for the business traveler is that theres an iron (and an roning board) in every room! The rooms are very small but they're quiet, clean, well decorated and comfortable. At around 110 pounds per night you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a very small room”
Reviews.Author: Consulty
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews but didn't expect the room to be so small, it just takes a double bed with the TV mounted on a wall at the floor at the foot of the bed. Tiny shower etc - ok for one person for 1 night but this was booked for 2 people. Good location if you are using Paddington. Looking at the room map there are 8 or more of these tiny rooms in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well presented but room unacceptably small”
Reviews.Author: MP23_10
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good location - close to the wonderful Hyde Park and the surrounding Bayswater area has charm & character with interesting range of restaurants and quirky shops.Close to Paddington rail and tube station and to Lancaster Gate tube. Quiet at night. Well presented - neat decor, clean and tidy. Nice breakfast with decent range of hot and cold options. Overall price was reasonable. Negatives: Room was way too small. I felt closed in and I am not prone to that. Ensuite bathroom was the smallest it could be without losing functionality. Breakfast room capacity was insufficient - often a queue therefore. Staff- reception lacked warmth / personality but there were some other cheery souls and most tried to be helpful. Breakfast staff courteous and attentive. Conclusion: Unlikely I would use this hotel again despite the good location. The single room I had [132] was unacceptably small.

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday”
Reviews.Author: sweetmarryw
Reviews.Content: The Best Western is located conviniently few minutes walk from the train station and underground paddington. In this hotel as a you can find the area that is with free wifi internet in the bar area, and rooms has internet with cable. there is also internet computer and printer, The room where we were staying was spacious and cozy with a huge bed, provided there is also a kettle with various types of tea or instant coffee bar fridge microwave safe tv and ironing board. the bathroom is not big but has everything you need and clean. As we are concerned the standard of cleanliness was good in both the bedroom and outside in public areas. The breakfast was buffet and was great and hot. The staff is halpfull and friendly. For those interested in a picnic in the narrow streets and surroundings of paddington outside the hotel there are a dozen bikes to rent a buying the token with recycling stations located near the bike. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit London and be in a few minutes in the center. But at night he wants to sleep in a quiet neighborhood not chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, clean and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_SA
Reviews.Content: Each time I visit London I stay at the BEST WESTERN Shaftesbury, Paddington Court. Having experienced other hotels in the local area, this is by far the best within this price bracket... and it's in a great location! Obviously rooms vary according to price and having stayed in the club room and on more recent visits a single room, one thing that is consistent is the cleanliness of each room I have stayed in. The single rooms are petite however they are adequately furnished. On my most recent visit I did have an issue with a poor quality pillow that resembled a piece of rolled out dough, but with persistence and once brought to the attention of the duty manager this was resolved amicably. The lobby staff are friendly and helpful, though for me the staff in the breakfast room win hands down with a friendly attentive service :-) Until my next visit.... thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but very small room!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea186220
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel, nothing special and incredibly small rooms. On the other hand, very close to Paddington station and reasonable rates. For a city hotel was very quiet, no obtrusive traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the cost”
Reviews.Author: hebby
Reviews.Content: Outside of the hotel looked promising as did the lobby and bar. However, my designated room was tiny, on the ground floor next to an elevator shaft. I asked for a different room which they gave me on the third floor. It was hard to find the room as there were few signs, whilst some of doors on the stairs were hard to get past (the doors opened onto the stairs with no landing room). However the rooms were nicely finished if a little cosy, but fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Patricia C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel works for me, I even have a favorite room #555. It is very handy for me as I arrive from Somerset using Paddington Station, everywhere I go proves an easy reach. The people are extremely friendly, helpful. In short, I like everythng about the hotel and never plan on staying elsewhere. Up until now I always used the Swiss Cottage Hotel, it doesn't compare with your hotel

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: P L
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the comments on this hotel I did wonder what my room would be like. I was given room number 2 a pleasant double room overlooking the road, the double glazing was excellent so no road noise noticed. The room and bathroom were clean with plenty of cosumables and good quality towls. My only observation was that the dressing table/desk was on the small size. Otherwise I was completely satisfied with the accommodation. Mr. Singh and vinayak Duty managers were very helpful throughout my all stay. Dinner, I took the B&B package and I had a satisfying meal in the clean and well presented dinning room. From my experience at this hotel I will gladly return. I found the room, staff and breakfast very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Tinest room I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah T
Reviews.Content: Decor was fine, fairly newly done and the room was clean. However it had clearly been designed to fit the maximum possible into a shamefully tiny room. It was a queen size bed, not the double I had paid for and there was only room for a bedside table on one side. The shower room was absolutely tiny, a little square room that jutted out into the bedroom, limiting space even further. I travel quite frequently, typically staying in London twice a week and I have had rooms of far better quality for less than I paid for this room. It was very obvious that the hotel has been designed for maximum occupancy with detriment to the guest experience. I have never ever stayed in such a small room and this hotel is meant to be 4 star! On the plus side the staff were friendly and helpful. I would not however recommend or stay at this hotel again. There are many better hotels with reasonably sized rooms in London, so I would advise that you shop around rather than settling for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Initially sceptical but everything ok!”
Reviews.Author: bob s
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the hotel as a top secret hotel on late rooms. Upon finding out the identity of the hotel I consulted trip advisor and found quite polarised reviews. In particular those who had booked through agents complained of being relocated or getting a dingy or dirty room, poor service etc. I was really worried as a result. However, I rang the hotel, spoke to the manager and calmly explained my concerns. He kindly said that there would be no relocation and that I'd get a good room. I stayed in a club room and it was really decent, with plates, cutlery and sink. The bathroom was nice and the room albeit small was clean unlike those mentioned in other reviews. The staff were unlike the highly negative reviews and were competent. Thanks to the manager. I would consider staying here again if I could be guaranteed the same or similar standard of room.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay but a three not four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: nettraveller_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights over a weekend, like alot of previous guests a little anxious after reading some of the reviews. Our first impression was a unimpressive lobby and while waiting to register, watching two couples being asked to transfer to a sister hotel with the compensation of a free breakfast!! I choose a hotel on the basis of location as much as anything and would not be at all pleased to be asked to move especially as this seems to happen frequently and no amount of complimentary would have swung it. We however got our Club Room in the hotel we booked. Although the room was well appointed with, microwave, fridge,robes, fruit, wine,etc. it was a little dated and still small, the bathroom the smallest ive ever seen with only a 2 foot square floor space, but clean and modern. Our bed a super king was very comfortable with its new mattress. In fact they had taken delivery while there of dozens of new mattresses. We had a view of the garden on the first floor which was fairly quiet, and you could open the window a plus for us The lounge/bar area was fine but the exclusive Club lounge was a small, narrow, windowless basement room that no one would want to spend any time in. Breakfast was fine a good buffet choice of either a cooked breakfast, pastries, cerels, yogurt, juice and fruit. Shame again also located in the windowless basement. Could not name lots of members of staff as some reviewers, as we were out and about most of the time, but they seemed friendly We paid just under £200 for two nights in a Club Room with breakfast and for this we got a pleasant stay, if i had paid alot more i would have been disappointed, in my opinon a three not four star hotel. One concern was seeing lots of suitcases not locked in a secure room but in the corridor, for anyone to walk off with.

Reviews.Title: “Rather bad”
Reviews.Author: Abramis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night. I selected this hotel due to cheap room rate, rather reasonable ratings + location (near Heathrow express). And in general I was expecting modest 3 star hotel. The pros - It is nearby Paddington station / Heathrow express - Check-in was quite ok The cons -While check-in I spotted drunken English speaking guests. These gentlemen were rather noisy -Getting to my room was so difficult that I had to be escorted to my room (terrible layout) -Plenty of stairs = hotel is not suitable for elderly visitors -My room was extremely small (just fit for sleeping) -Bed was unpleasant -Furniture was old, everything was rather worn out -Aircon was rather noisy -Bit mouldy smell -In case of fire, it might be difficult to get safely out from some rooms (lay out) I am very happy that I stayed here ONLY one night. Would not recommend this hotel to anybody. I really do have to say that I am surprised this hotel has received several rather OK reviews.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: I have been 2 times in this hotel and they were not able to find my reservation. They let me wait for more than one hour at the reception and I had to delay a business meeting. Staff proved to be unprofessional and totally unfriendly. Never again in my life. Sleep at the airport instead. It's the worse hotel you can get in London. Even expansive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Rememberable and amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rav K
Reviews.Content: I was here for my business trip as well as some personal trip with my family.i was bit worried about this hotel and it was difficult to make desicion about choosing this hotel due to few comments regarding transfer from other traveller.i decided to call to the hotel before making booking.finally I checked in to this hotel and was treated very well and service was superb.personally rooms were small in size but were good value of money.At reception duty manager Mr. Singh and vinayak were very helpful.Upon departure staff were requesting people's to put their comments on TRip advisor and I think it is a good activity too .i will strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if your allowed to stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: smiffyj
Reviews.Content: We came to stay for one night at this hotel and yes they tried moving us to there sister hotel in Barbican. No prior warning of this was given and the sister hotel only rang me as I was at the reception of this place. They tried to make out they were doing me a favour by saying I would get a free taxi, breakfast and 5 star luxury. Not good enough as I had to be at Abbey Road studios within the hour so did not want to be messing about being moved to another hotel. After telling the hotel I found what they done unacceptable miraculously a room became available. I was told however it was not ready and had to freshen up in a disabled toilet. My bags had to be left at reception and I had to re-check in later that evening. When I returned they did put me in a club suite so cannot complain there. Room was lovely with big beds but very hot. The location is excellent only 5 mins walk from Paddington. I would advise to check out the nearby Hilton before checking out this hotel. And don't be fooled by them asking to move you due to work being carried out, it's a con and if you complain enough you will get a room in this hotel. I even asked where these renovations where taking place as not a piece of work equipment in site, they never knew where to put there faces. Not a bad place but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job!!”
Reviews.Author: Wasawilson
Reviews.Content: Got a bit concerned about our upcoming trip to London when I read the reviews a couple of days before we set out. Need not have worried, we had a great experience. We were warmly welcomed, allocated a newly refurbished, splendid room and enjoyed a most pleasant stay. The things that matter in a London hotel were all present and correct, a good bed with wonderful sheets, a great shower in a tiny but perfectly formed bathroom and a great location. Would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation near Paddington Station”
Reviews.Author: billaholic
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, reasonable price for main part of London. Rooms are very small but very well appointed with luxurious feeling furniture and bedding. Free internet connection in room and wireless in lounge. Didn't eat in the lounge but the smells were absolutely inticing! Originally put in a truly tiny room at the back of the hotel where I could hear a door from an adjacent building constantly banging in the wind. I told the front desk and was immediately reassigned without question. I went about my day touring London, while they moved my bags and got me settled in a better room! Great Service and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Carosatty
Reviews.Content: The room was nice with a window over the street that was a nice view but totally quiet at night. Room was small but they all are in London. It was very expensive, but we booked last minute & we've heard it is hard to find cheap & nice at a much lower cost. Within walking distance to notting hill, hyde park, paddington train station (where you can take the heathrow express into & walk to the hotel which saves cab/tube costs), not too far from the other main attractions. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel because cafes nearby were cheaper. Internet free for laptops via cable cord in room & there's a free computer & printer in the lobby. Very clean & helpful staff- would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very much below standards”
Reviews.Author: Shumi08
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through laterooms and info was misleading. The rooms were advertised as new but when I got there was shocked. It was room 132 advertised As superior single room the room was small with crammed furniture desk in front of wardrobe meaning you can't open the wardrobe and no desk lamp nearest light is ceiling light by the toilet door or ceiling lights above bed. The carpet was disgusting you could not quite see whether it was clean or dirty, it's also ripped as soon as you enter the room. All around the room the skirting boards are worn out and cobwebs by the window. Although the shower and toilet were updated I do not think this room in particular is fit to be let to anyone. The check in was not as informative nothing was said in terms of what's included in rate or what services are available. I stayed on the 3rd of march 2012.

Reviews.Title: “My base home in London”
Reviews.Author: SB-SanFrancisco01
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent value at the heart of London. After an 11 hour flight from San Francisco, I arrived at a very welcoming environment with a beautiful lounge to relax in while the room got prepared and my luggage was safely and properly transferred. A truly 4 star with great location, quality of service, and a remarkably clean environment. Most importantly, the managers and staff are competent, friendly, and very hospitable. They were genuinely responsive to all my needs from booking and scheduling to room service, carrying my luggage, and accommodation. They are really well trained and understand service and hospitality. This is my only London hotel review and I am strongly recommending this place to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: Priya G
Reviews.Content: I was bit nervous before booking this hotel as i have seen many negative reviews on trip advisor.But after confirm and speak to duty manager in prior to my arrival date ,i was assured by duty manager Mr. Singh that i will be given good room.Be honest i was given good room and good service through all hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Gems hidden in Paddington”
Reviews.Author: luis b
Reviews.Content: We are happy with our stay.We were upgraded to nice room and managemt was very good.Person manager who checked us out was very helpful.room were good sizw.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle H
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay in best western.I will definately coming back and will recommend this to my friend.Mr. Singh Manager was very helpful at reception

Reviews.Title: “no more than okay”
Reviews.Author: izzy96
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly, intially was being given a room on the 4th floor with no lift, when i objected was given a ground floor room with no problem at all. The single room was tiny, no room to unpack my case or put it anywhere, so had to remain on the floor at the entry, however it was well decorated and clean. The shower was excellent, towels replaced every day, usual toiletries supplied. Did not have the breakfast at £15 a go, cant imagine what they serve which would justify this price it is ridculously expensive, there is a cafe at the corner which does a full english for £5. Location is good for getting around london equidistant from either paddington or lancaster gate tube stations. walking distance to bayswater and hydepark. It is a lovely hotel, however i had stayed at kew gardens travelodge the previous 3 days and i found that to be just as good and a lot more spacious and comfortable at a lot less cost.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD AT ALL!!”
Reviews.Author: brit1985
Reviews.Content: This hotel is BAD!!! stayed here about 2 weeks ago and again like many others i was transferred to their sister hotel. It seems like there is a scam going on here!! because I've looked at reviews dating back to september last yr and this sort of thing was happening back then!! The room was the tiniest I've ever seen!! That small that it was smaller than my daughters box room in our house!!! The walls are very thin and u hear everything!! So if you want some sleep then do not pick this hotel!! I can't believe the prices they are charging and getting away with because it is certainly not worth the money u pay! I have stayed in nicer Bed and breakfasts than this! The bed was uncomfy and TINY again! Oh and I've saved the best to the last......I found a toenail in the bed!!! Certainly not mine as i do not wear red nail varnish! Discusting!! Luckily i was only booked in for the night! I booked a double but it was smaller than a double!! Will definitely not be returning to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away its more like a 1 star not a 4 , AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: keithuk1977
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington when I arived they told me my room is no longer available due to hotel maintence?? I book a suite and paid alot of money for this room. Anyway I got transfered to there sister hotel @ NottingHill and was told its still a 4 star and a beautiful hotel. I arived at this hotel checked in and went to my room it was small dark and only 1 window facing a wall, this was bad but it was to get worse i started hearing loud banging coming through the celing it was the aircon it went on all night I could not sleep, also no mobile phone signal at this hotel I had to go outside the hotel to book a room in another hotel. When checking out I told staff I was not happy they smiled said ok and bye bye they where not bothered about losing my custom.Ohh one last thing the bed had small blood stains on the sheets and small curly hairs.... So avoid stay clear your not getting a good deal your geting ripped off

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the Plague.”
Reviews.Author: memailer
Reviews.Content: This was a farce. I will never book with www.booking.com again. On arrival to Best Western Shaftesbury, Paddington I was told there was maintenance works, so I had to move to a different hotel, I had no choice. From reading other feedback this it appears this might be a scam where you are sold one hotel and then moved to hotel of lesser standard - or one with a poorer tripadvisor rating. The hotel I was transferred to Grand Royale Hyde Park. It has no restaurant, tiny rooms, no gym, and no room service. On asking for room service I was given a takeaway Pizza menu. Avoid Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington. Avoid Grand Royale Hyde Park. Avoid www.booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality for a good price at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stevenn1983
Reviews.Content: I chose the Best Western mainly because of it's decent price and it's great location (just above Hyde Park). Room was very small but clean and quite comfortable. Breakfast was excellent and staff acted friendly. If you use this hotel just as a base for a London city trip (so don't spend to much time in the hotel itself), I can recommend this one! Minus: WiFi was only available in the bar area, not in the rooms itself.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Alcastle74
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Paddington Station, three steps from Hyde Park and Oxford Street to ten, in a very british and quiet with few restaus Indian in the corner. We had a small but opulent club room. The hotel is completely renovated . The staff was helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Keith c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Bayswater which is an ideal location for business and pleasure as it takes less than 10 minutes to get to the heart of London. We booked a standard double room and the rooms don't do too badly for space and luxury considering that this is a London hotel! The service was excellent right from the word go. The staff were friendly and very professional.This hotel is truly a gem and worth every penny! I will definitely recomend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comments on our stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilts_rob_b
Reviews.Content: This may be a duplicate of the information I tried to send before so my apologies. My wife and I stayed for one night on 4th February and booked the hotel through 'Laterooms' about 3 weeks in advance. For the grade of hotel it was about the cheapest and just where we needed to be. The weather was cold -it was the first day of the snow in London. Our check-in was very quick and efficient with staff being very helpful, one carried our suitcase across to the room which we had been upgraded to (a 3rd or 4th floor apartment with a small kitchen facility). The room was very clean and modern, and extremely comfortable. The lift was very good and quite as it was adjacent to our room. Despite overlooking the road between this building and the main hotel it was very, very quite. Being across from the hotel wasn't a problem as we were not using the hotel's facilities. We did have a problem trying to understand the air-conditioning controls but it turned out that we were trying to use the bathroom control which was in the bedroom whilst the main room control was in the lobby so my fault. However on mentioning this to the staff they were with us in less than 2 minutes to sort out the 'problem' and also brought a heater with them just in case there was a real problem. Staff very polite. Room was wonderfully warm I didn't use the hotel's facilities as I didn't have the time but everything was clean and tidy that I saw. Check -out was very quick and staff very good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in d heart of london”
Reviews.Author: Den C
Reviews.Content: very good location and reasonable price. very friendly staff and very helpful. The room was lovely, the beds really comfy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday, we assumed we were staying in the hotel but were put accross the street in the "suites" . A deluxe double room was booked ,in fact what we got was a bedsit, Mouldy bathroom, a wardrobe that you couldnt open the door to without moving the bedside cabinet. You couldnt sit at the desk as the drawers would slide out on there own. The bedding wasnt changed either. They provide a small kitchenette area with microwave, plate and a sink, but no cutlery, the bathroom door didnt even lock!!!! the hotel was so cold we had to sleep with jumpers on, we stayed the two nights we payed for because we couldnt afford to go elsewhere, When we complained we were told we could have a free breakfast but they wouldnt swap the rooms. We have since made a complaint direct to the hotel manager (13 days ago) still no word back from them!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: WilkesfamilyEvesham
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for one night in February. We were upgraded to a Club Room on our arrival. The room was lovely, the beds really comfy and really, really, clean. The staff were really polite and helpful. The only negative was you could clearly hear the television from next door's bedroom through the walls. Great base for going into central london and also Kensington Gardens is only a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paddington”
Reviews.Author: iphone0191
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several times in the last few years. The staff is friendly. Management is trying to improve every time. This place looks more like a House than a hotel. They know how respect of the guests. I am coming early 10 am in the morning & follow the way that time one staff His name is SOJIB asking ‘’ Hello sir.’’………‘’How are you today?’’…...‘’How can I help you?’’ …………All staffer helpful & very cordial, normally check in time in 2 pm but they have room aviable hear & they give me nice room for me. The furniture is nice but & it is clean. The price is fair. The good point is that you are allowed to use the fitness room & free of charge internet facility also. I agree that it has a overall very good management.Tnaks to Hotel manager & all staffs.

Reviews.Title: “i love it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very clean room and wide bed!!! I could use free internet and friendly staff was also good. There were some nice restaurant and super maeket, so we could get some foods and ate good meals.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: LadyJoulesRugby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 nights at this hotel i was disappointed that i had upgraded to a club room and they put us in the smallest room i have ever seen in my life when i complained i was told it was because they didn't have a club room free ?? we were moved immediately across the road to what they call a suite a small room with a kitchen in the corner the room although small was ok the bathroom tiny but modern ......our club package was brought to the room although we never did get the slippers or flowers as was quoted on our booking and the dressing gowns were grey and tatty our safe would not open and it took 3 phone calls and a visit to reception for someone to come and sort it ... it really is a shame to write a bad review as the staff were all very polite and 1st class i don't think i would stay here again i could have got a lot better for the money we spent.....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Marino_c507
Reviews.Content: Four days in London lived really well, thanks to the location and availability. Linked very well thanks to the dense London Underground network. A quiet walk in the evening, with the final stage in the bar lounge in the hotel, fantastic. I recommend it for those who intent to live in London for a few days without a break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley M
Reviews.Content: Old fashion hotel with comfortable room, excellent service and polite staff. Close to Paddington station and Heathrow Express, all perfect!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Raluca M
Reviews.Content: The modern design of the rooms looks great and all was very comfortable..the staff was very friendly and good to recive the guests..i spend wonderful time and don't have no hesitation to visit again this hotel..people from COURT really know to get to their guests hearts where others failed...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dariopanda
Reviews.Content: I was there with my girlfriend on a business trip. Lovely staff and good location. My room's dimension was standard, larger than the average London Hotel rooms. It was well equipped with quite stilish furnitures.The price was interesting and Internet was free. Unfortunately, although asked for, there was only wire connection in the room, while wifi was available in the common spaces. I had only one complaint: the temperature inside the hotel was more than 30 C, while outside it was chilly late october. We had to sleep with the air conditioning switched on!

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Mandybruise
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in good location , easy to travel in central London..as I notice all most of all the staff is friendly, esspecially from the reastaurent.. Nice place to chat and eat breakfast, one of the girl called meena, attended me, she is very friendly and good to receive the guest .. And nice team work in between the staff ..even though it's busy.. I suggest this place for people looking for a budget hotel in central London

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadya211
Reviews.Content: Ive been stayed ib Paddington court hotel.There is good service on not bad price.All staff were very friendly . Good wellcome from reception and tasty food in the restaurant.Breakfast staff were lovely.Specially thanks for Ananas (not sure for name) he make me feel comfotible and was friendly.Ill surely b back thanks to everyone!!!:-) :-)

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!! I'll definately be back.”
Reviews.Author: Gayter44
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a very "barely average" Best Western not to far from here, I was really dubious about booking another. HOWEVER, I'm glad I did as I was really surprised from the minute I arrived. The outside of the hotel was bright and well signed and the reception area was very welcoming. There was a smell of fresh paint which meant that they were obviously redecorating. Check in was quick and efficient and I was advised that my room was in the building opposite and downstairs! Expecting the worst and thinking I was going to be in a dark room with possibly no windows I was escorted across. On entering the room I thought they had allocated me the wrong one as it was a good size (I could walk around the bed easily), it was very clean and modern and it even had a window. Not only that... It also had a huge shower with a standard head and a rainfall head! There was also a small kitchenette with sink, microwave and fridge, which had I been staying a few days would have come in real handy I'm sure. The bed was comfy and the lighting good. The TV channel selection was also good. I almost wish I had more time to spend in the room! Breakfast was served back in the main building which wasn't a problem. The choice was great as was the service and the room setting. Checking out was as easy as checking in, with no hassle. I left my bag with the porter for the day and when I asked I was given the code for the free wifi! Having been so surprised at the whole experience I even completed a survey and handed it in on departure. Credit where it's due I feel. Normally these reviews only tell you about the bad things and not the good. In this case I have no adverse comments! I would like to think that this wasn't a one off and will certainly book the Paddington Court Suites again to find out.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KeithLondonderry
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last weekend with 2 other couples. We had a small problem at check in (our mistake) but it was handled very professionally by the gentleman on reception and the manager. Rooms are small but extremely well appointed with large plasma tv, fridge and microwave. The location close to underground meant exploring london was easy and pubs around it were great. Breakfast was outstanding both mornings so would definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MRBENGTStockholm
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best London Best Western hotel I stayed in, comparable with much more expensive hotels (BW and others). The bed was fantastic, the room well designed, it was very quite and I had an excellent sleep. The breakfast was very nice, the receptionist friendly and professional, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tansy72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a club room. The rooms are a lot smaller than other Best Western club rooms I've stayed in but were very tidy. The thing that makes this hotel is the staff and the way nothing is too much trouble. After mentioning 1 or 2 minor problems these were dealt with promptly and with a smile. Breakfast was great, although if the hotel is busy you may have to queue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikova
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many London hotels,in most cases not very happy.I was very pleasantly surprised that I find this hotel. Rooms was excellent-beautiful,confortable and very clean.I have experienced fantastic customer service-especially from Swapnil,Srujan and Diana at reception,from the boy who takes care of my luggage and the girls who cleaned my room...The hotel is very nice and friendly.I will definitely be going back. I will recommend Shaftesbury Paddington Court London

Reviews.Title: “reasonable but drab”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: THe price was good for London rates. It was also close to many tourist attractions which made life easier. The staff were a little distant but pleasant enough. The room was very good, bathroom excellent, and flat screen TV on the wall. Sound did travel a little from room to room. Although there was a lift there were still some small staircases which made handling luggage difficult. Also, the lift was out of commission part way through our 2 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice & cosy"”
Reviews.Author: kath49245
Reviews.Content: Due to a problem at our Hotel we were moved to this hotel and because i didnt choose this accommodation i was a little unsure, On arrival at first i did not like the postcode but on entering the property the staff were lovely and helpful we left our luggage and went off for the day. when you go out of the hotel if you walk ahead towards paddington station up to mcdonalds you can get a bus there to take you to most places marble arch, oxford circus, euston station and many more or walk down the next street for many bars and restraunts. When we got back to the hotel we were shown our room (CLUB) it had everything you need for a 3 day break soft drink, tea & coffee, fruit, Robes, plus all your little extras for the bathroom GREAT. Theres a Bar- and the Breakfast room has catered for all- cooked breakfast , pastry, cereal, cold meat & cheese BRILL!!!!! The rooms are BEAUTIFUL and so are the Employees**************

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Fifer1980
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked lovely on arrival, however following check in we were promptly taken off to another building round the corner - Shaftesbury Hyde Park? Unsure why this happened (no explanation). No complaints at the time however we have brought bed bugs back with us!!! Complete nightmare and cannot believe a Best Western Hotel could have such terrible hygiene standards. Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: JPDeckers
Reviews.Content: We were moved here as the hotel we initially booked (BestWestern Shaftsbury) was 'overbooked'. I've seen a lot of single-person rooms in London, and the ones here were certainly not the worst, average+. Quite compact, but more than enough room to stay in. Coffee&thea on your room, small & clean bathroom. Bed was less good though, way too soft and heating was next to it: really had to turn it down else would fry my back. Also a bit too small, my feet were sticking out of it. Hotel bar was non-existant, walk down the street for some pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but clean tidy and excellent value. If you want to spend alot of time in the room then probably the size would be an Issue but we just went there to sleep and spent all day and most of the night out in London. Excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location, caring staff, very small room”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business and couldn't fault it for value, staff attitude, cleanliness, and hearty breakfast. The only negative was the size of the room, was was very cramped. Within 24 hours of completing a Best Western survey, I received an email from the front of house manager responding and inviting metro try for a second time. If you are planning to stay in Central London at a very reasonable price it might be worth try. Just be warned that the rooms are very small, but the staff are polite and friendly, it is clean and well- maintained, and the breakfast is plentiful and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris A
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel I've stayed in London in that price range, very nicely decorated, clean, fresh, only downside is rooms a bit small but not that big a deal unless your planning on spending a lot of time in your room. TV didn't work initially but fixed pronto with no hassles. Very friendly and helpful staff. Convenient location. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and thanks to front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: Suezen6969
Reviews.Content: The rooms very small but for English standard are decent and spotless.i had a small problem with the heating in the room but front desk staff and maintainence staff sorted out the issue faster than I thought. Special thanks to evening staff I don't remember their names it was a blond hair gal and the guy might be some Asian country and manager on duty was very nice and polite very smiley face, it was on Thursday 12 jan. I would definitely go back and recommend this hotel for family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and good value, affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Youngicon007
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay loved to stay here for next trip to London special thanks to Mr Rahul who sorted our payment issue which was double charge very politely he apologise did everything for us and make our stay more enjoyable. Regarding the room we got a room in opposite suites which was with small kitchenet and it was very nice and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent place”
Reviews.Author: ma85566889
Reviews.Content: Very nice place convenient located near paddington tube station. They have a great friendly and helpful staff and the rooms are well decorated and very cozy. Highly recomended, great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to play musical hotels”
Reviews.Author: spannerz20
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute special offer for a one night stay at the weekend. On arrival the receptionist informed us that due to 'maintenance' issues they were unable to accommodate us and we would be transferred to another hotel within the group. Reading other reviews it seems this is not an isolated practice and seems more like an overbooking policy. The hotel provided a taxi to get us to the new propery in Shaftesbury avenue and although we were initially annoyed at the inconvenience we ended up staying at a better hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Ksdgh
Reviews.Content: A great clean and comfortable place to stay. We stayed here for two nights and upgraded to clun room with price of double room. Hotel staff is veru friendly and always eager to assist you. Breakfast was lovely. Hot and properly cooked. Location is very close of Paddington station. I would go back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms well decorated and clean. Excellent value. Overall a hotel well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service- Best yet in London”
Reviews.Author: tanya123-11
Reviews.Content: From the minute you enter this hotel you are met with very courteous and polite staff. Everyone was very helpful, smiled and made you feel very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble. Speedy and informative check-in, great assistance booking taxis etc etc. The rooms were functional. Meals were good and very reasonable. Would definitely recommend it to others and we will be staying again at our next London trip. In short EXCELLENT customer service. Thank you :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rockerz888
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. Great location,nice , clean rooms. Staff were very friendly during our entire stay. Bell boy very Helpful in finding location. We would go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad20111102
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, and has been updated. For those with mobility issues, beware, as there are a few steps to be negotiated before reaching the elevator. Other than some of the singles, the rooms are of decent size, with very good amenities. Beware of some single rooms, however, as even for those single travelers expecting a small room, some single rooms would not be manageable with a large suitcase and also have a bathroom configuration that prevents using the commode comfortably. However, although our group had one single person in the group, the hotel was very accommodating in honoring a request to change rooms. And the new room was very comfortable and clean, with good lighting and enough space to turn around. The bell staff is excellent and very helpful, as are some of the front desk staff. The proximity to Paddington is very desirable for those traveling to and from Heathrow, and for taking public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: granvilleglos
Reviews.Content: first class, staff excellent ,nothing was to much trouble i like this hotel

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel with good excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: adele h
Reviews.Content: it was my business visit in london in december 2011 . I booked a deluxe double room in the hotel..The room which i got was not what i expected . I called reception to change my room ...........male staff at reception was good enough to come to my room persionally and he showed me 7 to 8 room but they were almost of the same size .... So i stayed in my room 203 ..Room size in the hotel is not very impressive but i was impressed by the staff .

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: Clo199
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days whilst sight seeing, shopping etc. 5min from tube station so easy to get about. Clean rooms, nice shower and bathroom and had a great little kitchen area with microwave if u don't fancy eating out. Staff friendly and helpful, only downside was no breakfast included but not much of a problem as plenty of places to grab a bite in London! Overall great for a shortish stay and reasonably priced would deffinately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Svetoslav R
Reviews.Content: I was in London for one week and have choosed this hotel to stay. I'm very happy for the time I had in the hotel. Breakfast was very good, staff was very friendly. The only problem was with the internet. Connection was so slow, that I prefer to go for a walk, instead of browsing :)

Reviews.Title: “smallest hotelroom ever!”
Reviews.Author: stefanie f
Reviews.Content: What you get is a tiny and very small room- we could not move....there was only a bed in it and a tiny way around it....not even space to put our suitcases down!!!! Would not book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay in a Shafetsury hotel again”
Reviews.Author: heather w
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed stays at many Best Westerns before but this was our first Shaftesbury experience. Hotel pleasant enough but our payment was process twice - once on arrival and once on departure and trying to sort this out is proving to be a nightmare. The hotel passed me round in circles several times between the same staff, the phone was put down twice and the receptionist laughed - all in response to just asking to speak to someone about a duplicated payment. Accounts dept just passed me back to the hotel again, and finally went to head office who told me I was wrong and the payment had only been put through once! An hour and a half later having sent of proof of my credit card bill I am waiting for a reply but at the end of the day definitiely not worth this hassle!

Reviews.Title: “How can they claim to be a 4 stars hotel?”
Reviews.Author: MagisterRome
Reviews.Content: London can get very busy in the first week of December, because of the holiday season in many countries in Continental Europe. I shall bear this in mind... I had to book my trip at the last minute, and I only came at this hotel because of the very limited choice. I got a single room for a "bargain" price in excess of £ 200 per night on a B&B basis. What did I get in exchange for my money? Very little. What they call a "single room" is in fact a cubicle where you can hardly move. Utterly depressing and to be avoided at all cost in the future. It is a mystery to me how hoteliers can get away with cutting to the bone room sizes and still retain a 4 stars rating. To me this is an absolute rip-off, and the only reason why I do not rate this establishment in the "terrible" category is for the kind and fresh attitude of their (predominantly young) staff.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: errinf
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews i was a bit nervous that i'd booked to stay here but i had no need to be. Amazing staff could not have been more helpful. Ok booked a club room and it wasn't a huge room but it was big enough and was spotless. Arrived to complimentary wine, soft drinks and fruits. A microwave and fridge hidden away are convinient but discreet. Arrived shortly after 11am and they checked us into a room within 5 minutes. When we left they held onto our cases after check out till we were going to airport. It's a 5 minute walk from paddington. Its on the bakerloo tube line (very handy). Breakfast was amazing but book direct with hotel as it's free when you do but otherwise £15 per person per morning. Bathrobes and slippers in room also shaving kit & tooth brushes and mini toothpastes. i'm already planning my next trip back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Did not like this hotel AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Val065
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two reasons - Best Western and location. In fact we wanted to use our BW points for our last two nights in the UK and London always being expensive we thought that this was the place to use up 64,000 points! Also the hotel is within walking distance of Paddington station and the Heathrow Express. We had read other comments on TA but thought, well, most hotel rooms are small in London, so we gave it a try!! Wrong! The room is every bit as pokey as others have mentioned, with the bed being stuck at the end of the narrow room, taking up most of the wall space. In fairness, the room was quite comfortably decorated and furnished but it looked as though very little thought had gone into the design of such a very tiny room. First there was the appalling lighting, then there was the badly designed bathroom... oh sure it had a trendy looking sink, but no space, and again poor lighting and mirrors. The towel rack was very, very high on the wall (probably because the room was so small that there was nowhere else that it would have fitted) then there was the shower stall which was really small and a toilet seat that didn't fit. We have in the past stayed at the Corus in Lancaster Gate ( very close by) and their rooms are also very small but they have amazing design features that allow you to be able to use the bathroom and room well - good lighting and mirrors, so it's not impossible to make small rooms that are functional. Then there is the front desk. They all seem to be vague about the hotel, we were not told where the breakfast room was or the bar, and neither are easy to find. The television stopped working, we called down to report it and were told that someone would be there immediately - no one ever came. Breakfast was good, though not included, it was however a buffet style full English breakfast. Even in there some of the staff, quite frankly seemed to be dense! The trouble with an experience like this is that you end up being intolerant of everything, because basically you feel ripped off. Oh and also, when we checked in we left our luggage at the hotel until the room was ready and I asked if it was put in a same room as one of the pieces wasn't locked "no, we'll put it out in the road" was the reply. He tried to make a joke of it but it hardly qualifies for good customer relations does it? Quite frankly I thought this place was awful!

Reviews.Title: “Do not tempt to thier discounts offers”
Reviews.Author: Hezkia
Reviews.Content: Even though I booked this hotel from your site, using Book.com system and got reservation code with a Nonrefundable amount, when I arrived to the hotel's reception at 19:00 they informed me that they had some problems and we will be moved to a different hotel. Instead of improving my superior double room I already booked, they compensated us with breakfast. So, around 19:30 transportation took me to Shaftesbury Hyde Park international hotel, where we got a tiny room with tiny bed (Not a superior and NOT a double bed , attached picture to demonstrate it). Only on Sunday we got our double room.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Staff / Small Room - Do Not Stay Here - Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Travler__Paul
Reviews.Content: I've just finished a stay at this hotel and to be honest it is the worst hotel I have stayed in, in years. So I arrivied on Monday, to get to my room I had to go accross the road. I got to the door and it was already open, infact the external security door never closed properly. So I walked in there and opened the door to this small room and a loud noise. So I called recpetion and said there is a loud noise coming from my fridge and the TV had a puple tinge. Another phone call to recpetion and 45 minutes later a porter came over and had a look, luckly the TV was just a loose connection so that was sorted out, how ever the fridge was opened and closed twice and then I was told that the porter would speak to the shift manager Another 45 minutes past and I had no reply from the porter, so again I phoned recetion to find out what was going on, the recpetist said they would find out, and again suprise suprise I had no responce from recpetion. So I deceided to order some food, I looked over the very limited menu and decided to have soup of the day (Which turned out to be the soup of the week) and a crusty roll and Haddock, Think cut chips and a wedge of lemon. So I asked how long this would take, 20 to 25 mins the girl said at the other end of the phone. 45 minutes later the food finally arived. I could of done better with my microwave. I started on my soup and I relised Ihave no roll, so yet again back on the phone again and my roll never turned up. At about 8:15 I had several issues, 1) My fridge was still making a very loud noise, and I had no response from the porter the came to look at my issue 2) My bread roll never appeared So I called the duty manager, and he told me that I would be moved in to a different room. The shift manager then said some one would be over, after waiting until 9pm I turned the fridge off an went to bed. Tuesday, Final some that was Ok, Breakfast! the sausages was a bit under done but all in all It was quite good. Tuesday Evening, I come back from work and the fridge was still not working and then to add to my pain the TV channels had stopped working, I called up recpetion and they said that someone will be over, to my suprise no one come until my food come. I was then told that there is a problem all over the hotel. I dont understand if there is a hotel wide problem, why could the recpetist tell me on the phone wednesday Fridge Still not fixed TV Still not working The trip continues!

Reviews.Title: “Cool location”
Reviews.Author: RockTraveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, cool, quiet location, resonable prices, lots of pubs nearby. It's possible to go to the Hide Park, Notting Hill, Kesington Palace and Paddington station walking.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are correct!!! Says it all really!!”
Reviews.Author: Rocket1Roy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel thinking the name would prove all other reviewers wrong, But, We was proven wrong, Its not even run by the best western so thats why its not very good, As we checked in we was greeted by a really happy receptionist (sarcarstic) who didnt know how to smile and didnt speak very good english, and as we had booked a club room thru booking.com we was allowed any of the club room bonuses like breakfast, inet ect ect! Rooms Were very very small, 18inches from end of bed to the wall, which was made even smaller by the flat screen tv! The duvet didnt even fit inside the cover , Enough said about this hotel, Dont waste your money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room yet in a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: mbt-ndg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to a) a Best Western because we often stay in their hotels world-wide and b) because of its location near Paddington Station. Although a clean hotel with classic furniture and a welcoming staff, the room was far too small for the quality/price. For example, I could but just squeeze past in front of the television to reach the other side of the double bed. Problems with the WiFi and turning on the TV in the room, but the staff did respond quickly to solve the problems. The other feature we did not like was the breakfast room in the basement--feflt like being in a dungeon. The staff couldn't cope properly with the overflowing number of guests at breakfast time. We used the service once only during a 3 night stay. mbt-ndg.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality accommodation at reasonable London price”
Reviews.Author: WayneCB1955
Reviews.Content: As a Best Western Diamond Rewards member I stay in many different BW hotels around the world. This hotel stands out as one of exceptional quality, especially at the rate they offer for a London hotel. Situated conveniently close to paddington Station and Underground. Friendly and efficient staff and a good breakfast. Try it - you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Shaftesbury London”
Reviews.Author: PijuDo
Reviews.Content: Im in the terrible camp I'm afraid. I had a suite it was actually a very small room with a tiny kitchen unit in the room. It was so small that my Wife and I had to take turns getting out of bed. Breakfast was good though and the bathroom was nice with a good shower. The windows rattled in the wind like a train was passing by.

Reviews.Title: “If only all managers were like this!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyJRoberts
Reviews.Content: Stopped here last week and was immediately greeted by the most wonderful hotel staff. Smiles!!! Yes folks, they do not cost a lot but boy do they mean a lot. Filming in London is quite exhausting and the equipment to lug about is sometimes no fun, but when staff help you without being asked, it is a true pleasure. The Manager was such a warm, friendly and hospitable man. Even when a woman played up, very unecessarily I may add, (probably saw the tv camera and wanted her moment) the manager dealt with her very well even though he had to endure her horrid snarling attitude. I wanted to take her aside and say to her, "Im a TV Presenter and I do not even behave in such a diva, pretentious way like you, where are your manners." I hate people who jump down people's throats when they are trying to help them. Even though this woman was wretched, the staff kept their cool and tried to appease the bad thing. That aside, the stay was wonderful, it had a lovely bar which was nice to chill in. Being the Queen of clean with OCD tendancies my room was immaculate and well attended to for my whole duration. Breakfast was lovely, especially the fresh fruit salad. Yes you heard right, fresh not nasty stuff out of a tin which you find in many hotels. If you are on business there is a board room area which is useful and for those staying in the club rooms there is a club lounge which was quite nice as it was quiet and I could type in peace. Would I recommend it? Most definitely, especially as it is a stones throw from the rail and tube station, no walking for miles with luggage!!

Reviews.Title: “2 night getaway”
Reviews.Author: greg2411
Reviews.Content: arrived 24th November (Gregs birthday) to a lovely smile and welcome from Corina at reception. Admittedly the 1st room was not to our taste but we were promptly offered a choice of two more rooms which we were delighted with. We were upgraded which was a lovely surprise, the room was sumptious, fab bed, very clean. We were spoiled! The breakfast was very good, the waiting staff friendly and attentive as were the reception and lobby staff. We will have no hesitation in returning to this hotel and have already recommended it to friends and family .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mel B
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every four-five weeks because of its location and facilities. I have always found the staff to be friendly and attentive, and any minor problem is always dealt with quickly and professionally. I have to admit that I was surprised to see some of the comments relating to cleanliness/bugs; this has never been my experience, and I have always found the rooms to be spotless. Prices, just like anywhere in central London, vary upon the dates chosen, but I find it hard to beat for location. It is quiet and located in a very safe areas. I warmly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for central London”
Reviews.Author: ninjakitty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick getaway, booked VIA laterooms and paid under £90 which is excellent for central London. It's about 10 mins walk to Paddington tube. The hotel has rooms in 2 buildings, I was moved to the separate building, I assume as I booked a cheap room. This caused a bit of a pain as I nadine to check in twice! 40 mins from arrival to getting in the room. Room was the smallest I've ever stayed in, but was well designed. We'd stay here again if in London, but only at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs !!!”
Reviews.Author: juliette f
Reviews.Content: Scratching!! went on last minute.com for a last minute deal. chose between a couple of hotels, but for location and the fact this was a named hotel (best western) this paddington hotel was excellent and looked decent enough, Staff friendly and helpful, and on entrance very presentable and clean. Room was very small but we only needed a place to stay so happy, room seemed clean and nice though very very tiny. we settled to bed at 12, and at 6am I awoke with a feeling of crawling over my arms. On checking there was a fat Bug in the bed, and another bug that looked different. There was a smudge (possibly Blood) found in the bed. I always check sheets when I go to a hotel, so the blood was ours.. The staff were very helpful and moved us to a bigger room, but once again, we found blood in the bed after a couple more hours trying to sleep . . look back to 2004, many many others have gone home to find hundreds of bites. This is a real shame for this hotel. Bed bugs ARE serious because you CAN bring them home and infest your home. Also you don't know how bad you have been bitten until you get home. . (apparantly) Best Western, if you are putting your name to this hotel, you are seriously damaging your brand if you don't do something about the bug problem!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The staff did look after us, the breakfast was decent. . yes the restaurant has no windows but fine and clean for breakfast if you look at this as a budget hotel. . and we were offered a full refund, but looking up bed bugs and how much this can cost if you bring them home. . this can be a really serious thing, some people get masses of bites, we only got a few (but we don't know as it takes 9 days for them to show fully!) AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you are happy to risk your life!”
Reviews.Author: JCW_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a double room on 8th Nov 2011 in the 'Suites' across the road from the main hotel. The rooms are very small as other reviewers have previously stated. They are reasonably well decorated but I would argue about the hotel being an "awesome 4* hotel" as Last Minute.com states in their secret hotel information. As to the room being 'a suite', this actually means it had fridge and a sink unit stuck in the corner of a very small double room.....hmmmm. When leaving the hotel for the evening, I noticed that the fire alarm panel was in fire but no sounders were activating. Being in the business of fire alarms, I know this means that the alarm had activated previously but had not been followed up properly. I was concerned that somone had manipulated the fire panel to stop the sounders activating in the event of another fire - the staff clearly didn't know how to operate the fire panel when questioned. On return to the hotel before retiring for bed, I informed the Hotel management, who were less than nonchalant about this issue. I insisted that they attend to it after I dragged the Duty Manager to witness the state of the fire panel for himself. On leaving in the morning, the panel remained in the same state, and again, I got the " we don't care" attitude from staff despite making me quite a scene in the reception. I have written to the hotel manager, the hotel company, Last Minute.com and London Fire Brigade as the hotel management is putting lives at risk - responses awaited. Please don't say you haven't been warned about this hotel - their ignorance to basic fire safety management is staggering and very worrying indeed where people are sleeping - and paying good money to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Elenaxx871
Reviews.Content: Stayed at room 407 on 11th and 12th of November. Found blood spot on the sheets, however initialy did not realize these were from bed bugs. Once back home found a bed bug in the suitcase and my body was covered in bites head to toe.....Had to throw all my clothes and suitcase away. Its a shame that the hotel does not inspect its rooms and provide safe accomodation to the guest. Make sure you ask about any bed bug history in the room you are staying at (even though I doubt they will tell you the truth..)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay. Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: queenlybee
Reviews.Content: We got a good promotional rate for a "Club room" double. It was like a mini suite. Microwave, mini fridge etc. Beautifully clean room and the bed was fabulously comfortable with beautiful bedlinens. Breakfast was fine. We found the staff everywhere to go out of their way to be helpful and were always very polite and professional. Yes, the television wasn't working, but someone was sent to sort it out and these things do happen! Easy walk to the tube station and all the nearby sights and attractions. Luggage storage for up to 5 hours was no problem and helped alot. I would most definately stay again . . . if we can get a similar deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent, friendly staff and service. I recommend and will book this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: tinneke_t
Reviews.Content: Beautiful reception, friendly staff. Good rooms but some of them are really small. We've booked 2 superior double rooms via booking.com against a really sharp price. 1 room was really great, the other obe really small, too small to move around with 2pers. BUT next day we received a club double room per compensation! Really great staff, service and location. No problem to store your luggage before check in or after check out. Nearest underground Lancaster gate and Paddington. "hire cycle" right next to hotel, really great and would recommend to discover london per bike. Hyde park is 1minute per bike from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Poor food and service”
Reviews.Author: cb83UK
Reviews.Content: One night stay while in London in business. Nice, good sized room. Modern decor and comfortable bed. Ordered breakfast in the room for 8am which never arrived. After calling reception to see where it was, I was told that it had been delivered but noone came to the door. How I was supposed to know they were outside me room if they didn't knock I have no idea!! When breakfast finally made it to my room it was awful. Croissants were not fresh, no butter or conserves to go with them and a teapot with no cup! Whenever I was at reception the staff were happy to get on with whatever they were doing or talking amongst themselves without even an acknowledgement. In short, ok hotel for central london if you can get a good deal on the price but don't expect much from the service and eat elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Decent standard, helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Britman_uno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from Paddington station, about 5 minutes. The public areas are all to a high standard, the room was normal sized (not large), The bed was large and comfortable -- wish I could say this for all hotels. We had no disturbing noises from other rooms or from outside. The ensuite bathroom was 'average' ie not great. Everything worked it was just little things like the mixer type shower was not very powerful, there had been some putty applied to the window which looked amateur. TV was good, Breakfast was excellent. Service was good too. If you want a a good pub to go to try the Swan, it is just a short walk away and the food was great and good value (but expensive wine). The hotel is close to the main parks so it is an easy walk across the park to the magnificent Albert memorial (worth a visit). and to the museums like the Victoria and Albert, Science Museum etc. Overall this was an unpretentious good standard hotel, fairly typical of Best Western hotels. I recommend it and would stay there again, the criticisms are relatively minor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Baleissa
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff excellent, room little bit small compare to standard, the room value excellent compare to the room size, location near padington station 5 minutes walk and Indian restaurants and small grocery shop.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing and thismis noy a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johnbamsterdam
Reviews.Content: Long line at check in and "upgraded" to a room in another building whereI waited again to check in. Room too small, not deluxe and by no means is this a 4 star hotel. Wifi did not work, nor did the cable connextion. Overall a bad expeirence in an overpriced hotel. Not worth the price and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms but a tad small!”
Reviews.Author: Tink_Loves_To_Travel
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice but be warned the lift is slow and there are lots of stairs. The rooms were very small but very nice. The view was onto the back of 2 rows of streets to not very private for them or us. Great location as it's only down the road from an underground station and Hyde park (which was beautiful). Very nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but very nice and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Beetle99
Reviews.Content: Having read the earlier reviews I was worried. However, the check in and service was great. We had a room on the suites across from main hotel. The room was small but lovely, possibly recently refitted as it felt very fresh. Very clean and none of problems mentioned in other reviews. We stayed on 4th floor so had nice views across london. The rainfall shower was great. Breakfast - full English was very good (apart from the coffee - sort it out guys). For £120 a night in central London I think this was a great deal. I would probably be diss appointed if I was expecting an American size suite but for the price I think it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable..Excellent staff..Would surely come again”
Reviews.Author: Inder Beer Sing... k
Reviews.Content: Our stay at BEST WESTERN Shaftesbury Paddington Court London was a dream as it was first time in London.We traveled as a couple.Chose to stay in Paddington after researching on the net.Excellent connectivity to the rail and the underground.This hotel is few minutes walk from the underground and is surrounded by all kinds of eateries and general stores.Very central.Had done the booking by www.booking.com.Beaware certain things promised by booking.com are not included .For example our booking said that fruit basket complimentary but that was not the hotel policy .Rooms are all new and very comfortable.Reasonable sizes seeing the london standard.(LONDON ROOMS ARE GENRALLY SMALL).Most of the staff at the front desk was Indian and they were very warm and go to great extent to overwhelm you. We had requested for a early check in as we were heading back from Scotland early in the morning.The staff was kind enough to provide us with a single bedded room as they were running full on the weekend.It was just fine with us as we crash landed.I just fell in love with the room.It was cozy yet luxurious.We were kindly shifted to our designated room later.The room was amply spacious , modern,Big flat screen TV,Comfortable bed,bathroom was spik and span.On our first day we had some problem with our telephone in our room. we requested to rectify it...Guess what.WE were upgraded to club room with complimentery breakfast.Breakfast wasfull english breakfast.After leaving london and traveling the whole of europe staying in 4 star hotels I realised the brekfast was actually the best here.It was a very good spread with ample choice.I just relished it.Hotel charges 12-15 Pounds for full english breakfast.For people who are on a budget dont mind the lavish spread can get breakfast across the street for 4-5 pounds. All our sight seeing tours had pick up point near the hotel and it was very convenient.Our stay at the Shaftesbury was absolutely worth it.We would defenitely reccomend it and come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A super stay!”
Reviews.Author: hmparis
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two night stay at the Shaftesbury Paddington. The staff were attentive and courteous, the room was spacious, spotlessly clean and very well-appointed.Little details such as chocolates left on the bed along with little greeting card messages made us feel very pampered! There are a few stairs to negotiate but that really isn't any bother unless you are physically disabled, and even so there is a lift and some extremely helpful porters willing and eager to assist. Breakfast was well-prepared, plentiful and pleasant. In all I would absolutely recommend this hotel in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Typical of The Stories Already Mentioned”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 5 nights for a business trip. I read some of the reviews on sites such as this and it seems a lot of people have mentioned being moved out to other hotels for various different reasons and I thought they were just isolated incidents. When we arrived at the hotel we faced the very same problem. Apparently there was a plumbing issue (which seems to be the excuse of choice) and we would be actually staying in a different property. I kicked up a bit of a fuss and pointed out that I had seem exactly the same thing happening in the past, they gave us rooms. They eventually said that the plumbing issue was in the other side of the hotel and they were worried that it would spread. Fair enough, but the people checking in next to us were being moved because there was an electrical issue!! Over the course of the 5 nights we constantly heard guests being told they were being moved to other hotels for a whole host of reasons. I emailed the General Manager asking for an explanation but only got a generic 'sorry' email. Maybe the complaint I have just emailed to Best Western might get better results. Its a shame really but as the rooms are really nice although small and the complimentary WiFi is only restricted to the bar area. There is hard line internet in the rooms but mine wasn't working but my colleagues was. Just be aware that with this hotel and the Shaftesbury Group, you may not actually be staying in the hotel you booked. I recommend you ask the questions why you are being moved and mention you have seen may reviews such as this.

Reviews.Title: “Insect ridden”
Reviews.Author: tom460
Reviews.Content: Ever gone to bed really tired and woken up at 4:30am not sure why you have woken up...? Cant get back to sleep for some reason and feeling restless? Got a niggling feeling that something is not quite right? Why not check if the 4* hotel bed which you payed an extortionate amount for is riddled with insects? Nothing like taking 3 showers in a row at 5 in the morning trying to wash away the itch. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “flea pit!”
Reviews.Author: very angr y
Reviews.Content: I was bumped to this hotel as the Earls Court Best Western had overbooked (though they claimed they were doing maintenance). Was put into a pokey little room, which for the price of what had been pre-paid for the reservation was outrageous. Woke up the following morning covered in insect bites; either fleas or bedbugs. had to rush in the morning as the hotel was far from the underground, so wasn't able to complain. Dreadful hotel and will make a point of never staying at Best Western hotels ever again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not repeat”
Reviews.Author: GGZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just tiny, I stayed in a single room and I think I had the smallest bed ever seen. In the bathroom, when you try to wash your face, wash basin is so little that you will also wash your feet. Same happens with the desk in the room, you get internet by cable, but there is no place where you can put your laptop. I would not say staff is not nice, but they just ignore your inquiries. Their first room was in the basement, I asked them for an upper floor and I just got one in front of the entrance stairs of the houses in front, which they have annexed as hotel. My air conditioning did not work in four nights stay, after talking to reception twice. Same with the lamp by the bed, the bulb had been dead for ages, and they did not change it even when I asked for it. Location is what the name says, Paddington, what I would say should not make the choice for this hotel, for there are lots of alternatives in the neighborhood. They make you pay just before checking in, I think this is for you not to look for another hotel once you have seen the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Mariam88
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay last minute and the hotel was great with helping us book a double room for the same day. Although the room we had was a bit tight for 2 people, it was very clean, comfortable and well-equipped. We came back to find it tidied up and bathroom toiletries refilled on both days. Check-in and out was very easy and quick, and all staff was very friendly. It is also conveniently located - a short walk away from the Lancaster Gate station that has easy access to the downtown areas. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outbooked to a sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul N
Reviews.Content: I stay in London 2/3 nights every 3/4 months and am appalled by the price for shoe box rooms. I usually booked the Shaftesbury Metropolis and was warned to check in early as you risk being outbooked to a sister hotel. I rang at lunch time to check if I could check-in to be told I was being outbooked to the Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court London. This meant I was further away from the office which was the reason I book the Metropolis. Checked the Web site to find the Metropolis was now selling the room I had booked @ £407 (I was paying ££125 average over 2 nights). As a rewards member did I get a better room. No chance. I was in the basement where room numbers had no logical sequence (even the staff member could find it) The room itself was tiny just enough space to walk around it. In fairness it was clean and very well decorated with a good size TV. The bathroom was very well presented as well but completely impractical.
