Television did not work nor did the phone so was given a free breakfast - that was a joke. Breakfast was a free for all, no seats, no plates, only 2 young staff, no coffee, tea !!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended...”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to waste too much time on this review as I would not recommend staying here... Despite having a 'Club Room' the bathroom was tiny and you couldn't move in the shower. The mattress was sagging and the bedding didn't fit properly. We were on the ground floor and were woken up in the middle of the night by someone knocking on our door (not really the hotel's fault) and then the dustbin men collecting at around 6.30am outside our window! You could also hear everyone in the corridor and what they were saying. Breakfast was chaotic, no plates and no service. Grabbed a roll and then had breakfast elsewhere! The hotel isn't that close to Paddington, others are closer, but you can park for free on nearby streets between 10.30pm and 8.30am. The room also had free internet that was okay. These were the only positives. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: tjz1100
Reviews.Content: I'm liking the shaftesbury groups hotels, they're cheap-ish, available, clean and friendly. Definitely on the list of repeat stay places.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cakesandtravel
Reviews.Content: We were originally meant to stay at Best Western Premier Shaftesbury Kensington but were told the night before we were due to arrive in London that the 'hotel is currently having an unavoidable maintenance problem’ and they would be moving us to the 'parent hotel'. They contacted us so late the day before that we were unable to make alternative arrangements. When I read the reviews on here we still thought we should stay in the hotel simply because there wasn't much choice. The service was POOR all round. When we first arrived we were made to queue for 15 minutes whilst one staff argued with a group of men. Then I had to try and get the attention of another staff who just walked passed us. After 2 attempts to get SOME attention, I shouted 'excuse me' and I was forced to ask them why there was only one staff behind the counter. FINALLY a staff member bothered themselves to get behind the counter and start attending to the queue. We were given our key cards and told to go across the road to our rooms. We had no staff actually showing us the building and we had to come back and ask for assistants. After dragging our suitcases to the third floor, we entered an ok sized room with a king size bed. The big bed was very unnecessary and took up most of the room, the bed felt comfortable. The bathroom was very small (the toilet and shower were in the same tiny room). I could only imagine that someone slightly over weight wouldn’t have been able to enter the bathroom. In the end, we had to ask for our money and go find a better hotel. If you can avoid it, don't stay at this hotel, unless you don’t mind standoffish staff. Best advice I can give the hotel is to employ professional staff, from my experience an ok hotel can be uplifted by having friendly, helpful staff and make the experience worth while. I can honestly say had the staff been friendly and helpful (or even cared about the fact that we were staying there) we wouldn't have been so quick to want to leave. Only positive is the location, but there are other hotels around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fair swap”
Reviews.Author: Daffodils52
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Shaftesbury Kensington but they had a boiler failure and swapped us the day before saying we would be upgraded. Room very small 2 beds pushed together and not very confortable, If this was an upgrade would hate to see what the original one was like. View was a 3ft and 6ft whitewashed wall. I asked for a room with a bath but they only had showers available which were tiny as was the bathroom. The toilet seat was broken on one side but there was sufficient soap etc. The reception staff were very abrupt and weren't very helpful,they had a very much a 'take it or leave it' attitude. We ordered bar food and waited more than 40 mins for it to arrive. Breakfast was ok but not much choice and not very hot. It is close to Paddington Station and they will hold your bags for you on checkout if required. I stay in hotels regularly on business and I must say for hospitality this was very poor. You are very much treated as just a room number.

Reviews.Title: “Shaftesbury Hotels - you never know where you will be spending the night”
Reviews.Author: daisiemay
Reviews.Content: This was interesting to say the least. As 3 female travellers we had booked a twin and a single. The twin was in another hotel down the road! That was unexpected. Admittedly it was a lovely up graded room in the Shaftesbury Park hotel. 4th floor club room with everything. Sadly I was Billy no mates left at the original hotel. I was in a basement room on my own. It was small to say the least ( although very clean). The TV was bigger than the bed! I was unable to sit squarly on the toilet as there was no knee room so had to 'side saddle'. The bathroom was so small that my bum hit the door when i tried to wash in the wash basin. I was also concerned about the basement location. I did have a window overlooking a small courtyard that led to a main road but i couldn't leave the window open due to security. It would not have been sensible for a loan female in London and the room was HOT. Very, very hot. It was like a sauna and the pipes in the ceiling moaned all night long. The bar was closed when I got in at 11pm and there was no room service . After a very uncomfortable night i found my fellow travellers had thoroughly enjoyed the upgrade. They had room service, a lovely spacious room and I was very happy to join them for breakfast after looking at the dismal basement restaurant in my own hotel. I would go here again but not on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in central London”
Reviews.Author: DrNostromo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in February. Having stayed at a number of hotels in the Paddington/ Hyde Park area over the years thought this one had a lot going for it and would have no qualms about returning someday. Location is very good with Paddington Station, Hyde Park and Oxford Street all within walking distance. Plenty of varied restaurants, pubs and bars in the area, which always makes for a good stay as you are not stuck in the hotel and can go out and explore the area. Yes the rooms are small but are certainly a good step up from standard hotel accommodation in London with a large flat screen TV and luxurious bathroom fittings. Rooms are also very very clean, dry, warm and have air conditioning units, none of which are guaranteed in all the rooms you might find in London. When I arrived the TV in the room was not working and it was difficult to get staff to understand what the problem was due to their grasp of English but I have found this to be an issue all over London, due to staff shortages, and it was sorted within 12 hours. Considering price of hotel, location and free Internet I would recommend this hotel to be an excellent choice of place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay! Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: PZBA
Reviews.Content: Terrible! This hotel was disastrous. Poor ventilation, broken bathroom exhaust fan, TV broken with loose visible wires. After 2 nights I developed red itchy bites all over...bedbugs! Carpet was dirty and smelly. The only semifunctional facility was the WiFi which worked intermittently. The photos are misleading regarding space. We booked a deluxe double and the bed just about spanned length of the room. Bottom line: Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “VERY small rooms but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyt_86
Reviews.Content: Was shocked how small the room was, there is no wardrobe, only 2 draws under the bed. It suited me and my parner though as we only wanted somewhere to sleep as we would be out most of the day/evening. I paid extra for a 'superior room' which im not sure it was! It was quite cheep though considering its in London. On arrival we were told that our room was in the other building and were left to wait in the reception untill someone just pointed us in the general direction of 'the other building'. I struggled to understand any of the staff as they are all foreign which didnt help. Other than that, the location is good if you want to go sightseeing, paddington station (including underground) is just up the road. I didn't have breakfast so i cant comment on the quality of that, however it does cost £15 so we went up the road and had a full english for about £8.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb”
Reviews.Author: Lovethemojo
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old son and I stayed here for two nights as part of a short holiday in the UK & Europe. The hotel is in a nice area, only 5 minutes walk from Paddington Station. Nice street. Looks good from the outside. The issues I had with the hotel were as follows: When we arrived, they did not have all the booking details (we had booked on Wotif.com). We were supposed to have : Mini fridge with complimentary drinks including half bottle of wine; flowers; fruit basket. None of the above were on their booking records, so we waited half an hour or so for the room to be readied. When we got to the room, we found that: there was no fridge! Apparently NO rooms have fridges because of some accident once upon a time. I can't recall the last time I stayed at a reasonable hotel that did not have a mini fridge. So we had the drinks, but they were room temperature. The barman only had one ice bucket when I asked for ice in the evening, so I could only keep that for a little while. The half bottle of wine was actually a quarter bottle. The room was small and too warm for me, but the heater wouldn't go completely off, and the separate room air conditioner wasn't very effective - not cold enough. We ended up with both of these running all the time but it wasn't particularly successful. The room was very small - normal for London hotels though, I guess - and became even smaller because we split the double into two single beds. The so-called English Breakfast was actually just access to their buffet which was very ordinary limited and not great quality, soggy pastries. A pity because the loved the English food during the rest of our trip. On the positive side, the staff were all very helpful. The concierge helped me with directions, and they were happy to look things up on the internet for me if required. All in all, the least favourite part of a two week trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed and won't be staying again”
Reviews.Author: sueb51
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for its proximity to Paddington Station - it that respect it was OK. On arrival, the staff were very polite and friendly, and we were able to book in early although we would have 20 minutes wait whilst the maid finished cleaning. We decided to have a drink whilst we waited. So the doorman came to the bar to serve us, but I don't think this was his forte. By the time we got our drinks, the room was ready so we took our drinks to our ground floor room. The corridor leading to the room was like an oven, even though the weather had turned mild and this was so unneccesary. I was very disappointed with the so-called deluxe "Club Room". It would have to be a very small, exclusive club to fit in there! The bed was two 3/4 beds pushed together, thus taking up most of the minute room. Because of the bed, only one of the wardrobe doors would open. There was a nice unit where the tea/coffee things were, with a top cupboard containing a microwave, 2 plates and some glasses. The cupboard underneath was obviously for the fridge, but this was missing. Again, the room was suffocatingly hot so we turned the heater off. There was an airconditioning unit but the flap was missing and a live wire had been wrapped with blue tape. It was dripping on the carpet. The bathroom was adequate but very small, although fairly well equipped with soaps, shampoos etc. Only one hand towel between us though. There were 2 chairs in the room, but we couldn't put them together to sit as there was no room. 1 chair was squeezed into a corner and the other was at the desk unit. The view from the window was over next door's derelict garden and the backs of the neighbouring houses, so I guess we were luckier than the people in rooms below us who would only have a wall a couple of feet away from their window. When I pulled the curtains, one of them started to come off as there was no stop on the end of the curtain rail. In the advertising blurb it stated free internet. We had considered taking our laptop, but since we were on a short break, decided against it. If we had taken it, there were connection wires, but the huge flatscreen TV (unnecessary in such a small room) had internet so we tried that, only to find that if you wanted to use it or any of the other services (film, games etc) the charge was £20 per day regardless of usage. Flowers and fruit were advertised as being part of the package with a large fruit bowl shown - we had 3 carnations, 1 orange and 1 apple which weren't topped up, the same as the biscuits. The breakfast was fine and the staff good, although some of the food was only warm. Overall, this hotel was extremely expensive for what it was, and a great disappointment for my 60th birthday treat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for the price - would stay here again (room 504)”
Reviews.Author: beweli2
Reviews.Content: Pros: Comfortable bed and very nice decor, bathroom was well-appointed. Mini kitchen with complimentary fruit, tea, cookies. Room safe. Free internet hook-up (bring your Vonage phone!) and free wifi in public areas. 3 different nationalities of electric outlets - plugged our American laptop right into the wall. Very pleasant and ample breakfast - staff was delightful and excellent service. Porter staff (especially Vlad) were very helpful and nice. Location was comfortable - not in the middle of the tourist areas, but not too far, either. Walk to the Lancaster tube station only 5 min. Nice and quiet - just a delightful 25 minute diagnonal walk through Hyde Park to Buckingham. Cons: Desk staff unprofessional. They weren't rude, just rather unpolished and not always able to help with the usual tourist issues (they couldn't give us directions to drive to Luton - but there's free computer in the lobby and they were happy to print out the Mapquest directions) . However, all complaints we had were addressed immediately and with a smile - they didn't make us feel we bothered them too much, though we had quite a number of problems: safe didn't work (they replaced it), one outlet shorted out (they came and flipped the fuse), blowdryer didn't heat (they replaced it) and refrigerator didn't work (never dealt with that - but we didn't need it anyway). No parking at hotel or very near. Had to park at Paddington Station a few blocks away for 22 GBP a day!

Reviews.Title: “LOOKS NICE BUT NOT UP TO SCRATCH”
Reviews.Author: mongoose277
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Best Western Premier Shaftesbury Hotel originally but once we got there we were 'upgraded' to this hotel as the Shaftesbury had a leak taking out 2 or 3 floors! The move was fine but we were woken on out first night at 4am by a guest in the room above because the floorboards were so creaky it was like a small elephant upstairs and it happened again at 8am when housekeeping went in to clean so be warned. POSTIVES A good location as it is close to Hyde Park & Oxford Street Breakfast was quite good although only served till 10am which is a bit early in my opinion. Bed quite comfy although 2 beds pushed together. Free WIFI NEGATIVES Reception were not helpful or polite. No mini-fridges in any of the club rooms because they had apparently broken down (although the rooms are single glazed so the windowsill makes an excellent fridge in winter!!) and the suites across the road had mini fridges but were like a shoe box. Housekeeping were fairly noisy at 7.30am and the doors really bang on the rooms so they need to get soft shutting fitted asap or you get woke up a lot - take ear plugs. The menu states a few meals that are round the clock room service however when we requested room service after getting back at 11pm we were told the kitchen was closed!! We were not asked how our stay ws on check out! All in all I would not recommend this hotel and were will certainly not be going back again

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: SpicyBrown
Reviews.Content: If you take into consideration how much we paid for the hotel ($100USD per night), it was worth it. This is a budget hotel for London, so you get what you pay for. The pluses - the location is excellent (only 10 minute walk to Paddington station), the decoration is very tasteful, room was nice & clean, in-room coffee/tea/cookies, located in a nice area with a couple small grocery stores and restaurants within a few minutes . The minuses - room extremely small, no closet space, beds rather uncomfortable, issues with internet connection. Good hotel if you're on a budget and want to be close to underground/train station.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient And Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TheHobartian
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was 5min walk from Paddington Station, which was convenient for getting to and fro around London, and for our arrival by Air and departure by train to Paris. The hotel was very clean and the "Club Room" in the main building was very spacious and tidy. The free internet access was a bonus. Staff were helpful and very accommodating. Very good for the price we paid on Wotif.com.

Reviews.Title: “impressive”
Reviews.Author: gabytzu92
Reviews.Content: The room was more than lovely and clean and after a very long journey we had a nice shower...bath actually , lucky us, in a hot buble water... we found complementary fruit in the room which was put there just because our booking wasnt yet in the system and the lady from there (Mary i think) she made it in 5 minutes... she offered us complimentary coffee for keeping us waiting 5 min...she smiled a lot and she had such a nice attitude.... really impressive . We had also room service which was very prompt and the food was great. I was surprised at the quality of this hotel especially after reading all this comments. Great location ad nice staff. i will definitelly go back ....

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bed Sheets”
Reviews.Author: bucklehouse
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and found that I had been allocated a very small basement room in a house opposite... I am in the hospitality business so decided to check the bed which looked well made and clean however on closer inspection found that the pillow had been used and had hair stuck to it! Yuk.... the best was yet come.. I pulled the quilt back to find stains and pubic hairs...Reception here I come! The staff were helpful apologetic and moved me to a room within the main hotel... very small room..very crowded with furniture and found that the curtains were hanging off.. tried to put them back so I could have some privacy only to find that the hooks were for a different curtain rail. Came back from work... wanted to get ready to go out... NO HOT WATER ( 6PM)... cold wash....sink blocked...... hair drier smelt of burning... left the hotel after two nights feeling tired Not a good experience... will not go back..

Reviews.Title: “SCAM-DO NOT BOOK”
Reviews.Author: kingkenny7
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 double rooms with this hotel last week on booking.com. Had read about people turning up and being told there is problem with the rooms but thought they were the exception. I no sooner gave the receptionist my booking details when I got that exact story. Had to be moved to another hotel further away from Paddington station. Yet, as we waited for a car to pick us up, other people were booking in to double rooms no problem. I dont know if it was just because we were Irish or because we had booked through booking.com. Although I have never had any problems with booking.com in the past. Hotel we eventually stayed in was a sister hotel but cost us more in taxi's etc. It was very average, very small rooms and bathrooms,bar tiny and only 1 key. Dont be caught out

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Debbiema10
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed here from 1st-3rd jan 2011 with my hubby & 2 boys. No complaints as to location, service ,room facilities, breakfast & staff all excellent. There was only one problem the room size a tad on the small size but it did not matter and it will not stop me staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: mandyhall1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in a double room booked on-line. The room was small but very nicely furnished with a shower room. The room had a TV on the wall which also had the internet too. The hotel was clean but the lift is noisy out in the hallway from our room. We did have some problems during our stay, on arriving they seemed to not have our booking or not beware of us coming? They then offered us 2 single rooms, which my wife was not amused at all! Also the TV on the wall did not work and they had to call the engineers the next day who said it was switched off in the building somewhere? For 2 nights at £150 (room only) in London it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms n overpriced even so called superior”
Reviews.Author: Zbobby
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not great tiny matchbox n not worth the price even though 55 pound forsuperior rooms w breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with good value when booked online.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPrincess13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights after our flight was cancelled by British Airways due to the "extreme" weather conditions. We had already signed out of our previous London hotel and were in desperate need of a place to stay. We were able to book this hotel online after speaking to the manager (Viniyak I believe) over the phone, who told us we would get a better deal online. We were given a room with full buffet breakfast and unlimited high speed internet included for only 59 pounds a night. The room (a club room) was extremely nice, very clean with a heated bathroom tile floor and a tv much larger than the one at our previous hotel. The buffet breakfast includes and assortment of breads and pastries, cereal, fruit and cheese, as well as lots of hot food (scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, grilled tomatoes and baked beans). The location is also great, as it is near Paddington Station and Hyde Park. My husband and I walked to Hyde Park to visit Kensington Palace no problem. In the other direction is Paddington station, which has the Heathrow Express train taking you to the airport, as well as the tube station. There are lots of restaurants around, as well as stores that sell cheaper drinks and ready made sandwiches if you want to save money and not eat at restaurants all the time. Near Paddington are fast food places such as McDonalds, Subway, KFC and Burger King. We found all the staff to be very friendly, always said good morning/good evening and were helpful with giving directions to tourist sights.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Beds, Staff that will try the best to help you”
Reviews.Author: Peter-Aussie67
Reviews.Content: I travel to London each month and have stayed at many Hotels , Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court London Is Clean, has Great Beds, Staff that will try the best to help you. The rooms are not huge , but the comforts in them are 5 star , every thing works, you dont hear noise from the next room , big TVs, tea making and microwave in my room. Fast cable internet and remember to bring your Lan cable for the room, the rest of the Hotel is Free wifi The bed sheets are soft and clean ,great pillows , and the room smells fresh and clean Thumbs Up

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Pokey room in the Attic, not very helpful staff at all!!”
Reviews.Author: neaady
Reviews.Content: after a horrible day of our flights being cancelled/delayed, we eventually arrived at the hotel at about 11.30pm. Booked in and staff were ok. however, we weren't told about any facilities in the hotel, not told when breakfast was or how we would get any or even where the restaurant was - no friendly welcome at all!! We were just showed to our room across the road from the hotel in a seperate building. No lift in the building and our room was up in the attic on the 4th floor - 66 windy twisty steps up to it! Eventually got up to our room to discover it was absolutley tiny, you couldn't swing a cat in it, the bathroom was literally just the width of the shower and you had to keep the door open to be able to stand comfortably at the sink. Nowhere to put our bags either or hang our coats. The only good thing i can say about the room was that the bed was nice (this was also the full width of the room) and it was clean (appart from the dark damp patches on the bathroom roof) and we had a good size LCD tv. Our view from the window consisted of the back of some old buildings to the rear of the hotel - horrible to look out at! And at night, there was some sort of fan or generator outside our door running all night. We still don't know what this was and even turned off our air con, but it made no difference! Eventually we got used to that sound though. To be honest, we didn't feel welcome at the hotel at all but at the end of the day, it was somewhere to put our heads down at the end of the night and it was close to Paddinton station (about a 4 min walk)

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Spawn48
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was not that Bad, we have just tried to enjoyed our time, but what i mostly like there was a pretty lady she was so elegant,polite,helpful and cheerful, she was a romanian nationality , her name is Mariana as far as i can remember, So she made things easier for us,we were surprised to see a receptionist like her there :) and Giving us a fully customer service, any way most of the staff was Good and helpful. Thx for everything again :)...hope to see u again in the next holiday. :)

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: carmens1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 2 occasions already. It is very well located , near 2 underground stations, close to the most important shopping street in London. The staff is very friendly and helpful specially Mary with a very positive attitude . I will definitely stay there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service great location”
Reviews.Author: Jkvs
Reviews.Content: I always stays at best western.I like this hotel particularly. The best is location very close to station. Oxford street is just 10 mins.staff very helpful especially vinayak and ravi credit to the organisation.I enjoyed my stay.although the room was small in size.bar location is not good.restaurant is cozy.l would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “my greatest holiday”
Reviews.Author: ioana62
Reviews.Content: Hello... This was my second visit in London. Despite of all comments, I've decide to stay at this Hotel because a friend of mine recommended. I was surprised and impressed by the attitude of the stuff. They’ve pointed the most important things to be seen in here , even I had already a plan; they gave me a good advice. The Hotel as a building is ok , the size is exactly what is specific to London. I wasn’t surprised by the size of the rooms after reading a little bit about England Architecture... I’ve booked a double room at a very good price( £109.00/night ) and the service was really good (clean room/ fresh fruit basket daily) . I will go there definitely next time !!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hospitality .Hospitalité exceptionnelle. Außergewöhnliche Gastfreundschaft”
Reviews.Author: arch_sd
Reviews.Content: During my stay on business for LVMH and for CHANEL UK, and PARIS, the Front Office Manager Vinayak Girgune and his reception staff Denise, John, Vlad typifies excellence in both Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) and Hospitality. During a complicated and somewhat overwhelming business trip the staff at the Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court London accommodated me with kindness, grace, excellence, and class.

Reviews.Title: “Worst manager ever seen”
Reviews.Author: gregg0001_0001
Reviews.Content: I am from United States..me & my partner went to london to enjoy our time and booked this hotel(hell). Around three weeks ago we stayed there.When we arrived to the hotel it was a big queue at reception for the checkin. now it was turn for the checkin and receptionist told us that we have some maintainence issues and we are transferring you to our sister concern hotel and you will come back to hotel tommorrow again, i said him that it is unacceptable, call your manager, he called the manager & manager said we will upgrade you to a club room (as we have booked for a double room) tommorrow....and went somewhere after informing receptionist, he was very rude,no respect for the guest, no customer service, full of attitude(like the way he introduced himself, i am manager, my name is viniyak something i dont remember). Receptionist who took the checkin was very helpful, he informed me that you will get free cab to other hotel and breakfast as well....Room was ok next day, not as per a club room.....i just wanted to share this bad experience.....as manager was very rude, bar was good, room bad, plz think before booking the hotel. i will never recommend this hotel....very bad experience, you should better change your manager if you really want to run your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If size really doesn't matter...”
Reviews.Author: Ming0861
Reviews.Content: The facade of the hotel is lovely, but inside, it's a labyrinth of small rooms opening off very small corridors. I couldn't use the safe because its door couldn't be open big enough. It slammed at an angle against the door of the cuüboard containing it. the cupboard door could also not be opned entirely as it was wedged against the small side table next to the bed which was already put tight against the wall containing a window opening onto another wall. The bathroom has very nice, modern fixtures_ I love a wash-basin to have a deep bowl, but if you spread your arms, you basically touch every surface. I'm not very big and I find the room very small. It was also on the ground floor which meant that I could hear every luggage being lugged or pulled along, every fellow guest outside my door. It did not make for quality sleep. But the hotel staff, mostly young foreigners were an attentive and pleasant bunch, in particular Pradip, the security man and his colleague, a fellow porter. They were always helpful and conscientious. I would say they were the hotel's best assets. Or one of two great assets. The hotel is very near to Paddington Station, great if you'd just come off the Heathrow Express and there are plenty of good restaurants and shops in the area. Diagonally across the hotel is Tuking, an excellent Malaysian restaurant. i am from S.E. Asia and currently live in Germany, and good Malay food is scarce on the continent. I have never seen so many tudong-clad women outside of a mosque in Europe and they always felt sufficiently at home to eat with their hands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: suthayil
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel and I would probably choose it again as it caters to my specific requirements when I travel on business to London every November. The staff are friendly and effecient and very proactive and responsive to any requests. The rooms are terribly small and difficult for a person to maneuver around if you have more than one suitcase. Breakfast buffet is good. The night before check out I had requested for a taxi to drop me off at the airport and the front office confirmed it. However on checking out and asking for the taxi, they said that there was no such request. Luckily I was well ahead of time and got to the airport on time.

Reviews.Title: “Small but well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: Teawhitenosugar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights bed only. The room (14) was incredibly small with about a 14inch gap around two sides of the bed. The shower was similarly sized and although the decor is actually quite stylish there are a couple of places wher the fit was shoddy. Excellent service from staff, free internet in the room was great and there's a variety of lovely places for breakfast just up the road so we chose not to spend £15 each in the hotel's breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hotel Horrible”
Reviews.Author: TotallyFinnish
Reviews.Content: Service was not as I would expect in this quite pricy hotel rated 4 stars. Staff at the reception didn't speak good English, during check-in they looked very confused about the amount of deposit and what is it for (there was not even a mini bar in the room) and didn't say a word about breakfast. Room was really small, dark and cold; damaged window facing some dirty office. The whole hotel is a maze, rooms are located in a very strange order, all doors are banging from 6 in the morning until 2 at night. Being on a business trip, I couldn't get a proper sleep for 3 nights in a row. Breakfast was ok. However, I will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: teejarillo
Reviews.Content: Seen some bad reviews about this hotel, but have stayed now on 5 occasions and not been disappointed. Worth paying the extra for the luxury rooms which are well equipped, comfortable and nicely decorated. Can't comment about standard rooms. Staff helpful if a little over worked at times. All in all good value for money in Central london.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: taz1985
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel 24 hours before arrival it was fine and said that they had my booking. Then turned up looking foward going shopping and theatre planned evening found out that the hotel had issues with the water. Had tp be transfered to another hotel in kensington had to plan alternatiuves routes etc. Why couldnt the hotel tell me earlkier even the taxi drive that picked us up said they do it all the time shifting people to diffrernt best westerns and this hotel had issues for a long time with there hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service!!! Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: CamebackfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Room and bath were very small. Service was terrible! Housekeeping did not refill bath amenities each day. Requested toilet roll twice from front desk and was not delivered until I spoke with Manager the next day. Manager offered free breakfast, but same thing the next night (no refill of bath amenities). Business colleague left me 3 messages at hotel but never received!!! Front desk staff almost competent and not always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in 20 years”
Reviews.Author: 255100Kate
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from Australia and were told that they were putting us in the hotel at the side of theirs. The room was tiny. I had booked double deluxe. it was 7ft by 8ft. The carpet was damp and it had a cabbage smell. I complained and was told to wait until the manager returned. while we waited at the Best western desk, 2 other guests complained about their rooms, one of them was very upset. We complained again and were given another room with no hot water. The shower was so close to the toilet it was a death trap. we had to run the shower for 30 mins to get warm water. Not too eco friendly. For a hundred pounds a night it was an incredible rip off. I have traveled for over 20 years and this was the worst ever. I have stayed in hostels better than this. Do not be taken in by the images on the website. The experience will be a horrific one.

Reviews.Title: “Another bad choice”
Reviews.Author: DellaNice
Reviews.Content: How difficult can it be to get an overnight stay in London with a decent service standard?? Clearly, it's very difficult unless you want to pay through the nose for the big chains. I live just outside London and was attending a big conference near this hotel, which I thought I had booked a room at and hadn't so was last minute looking at nearby hotels, all the decent ones were booked up. I came across this and thought how bad can it be? OMG I can't begin to tell you how terrible it is. The rooms are the smallest little cube boxes ever. There was no point to having a TV as you had to creak your neck to see it. Anyway, I was there literally 12 hours so wasn't that bothered but let me warn anyone who is thinking of a romantic getaway to London, don't book here, it's embarassing to this City. Given the fact it's an excellent location you would think they would be interested in making the most of the place. I did stop for breakfast in the morning before dashing back home but it was literally toast and coffee, the rest looked completely inedible. Grey sausages, grey scrambled eggs etc. The dining room was a good size but there was no mellow music just lots of clattering of plates and foreign accents in the kitchen shouting at each other. Oh dear.

Reviews.Title: “Good Fry Up & Location- That's ALL!”
Reviews.Author: Amethyst_Ice
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for myself and my bf by my mum as a gift- and for the price it certainly was! We booked a double club room that promised fruit, flowers, mini fridge, mineral water and wine. Oh and slippers! The picture looked spacious. Room 1- We were greeted just by asking for booking order, given room key and that was all. Not told where or when breakfast was etc. Got to the room..was tiny! Had 5 carnations in a vase (unlike the vast plumage of flowers from the picture) 4 pieces of fruit in a cheap wicker basket, no mini fridge, 2 small bottles of water and a tiny bottle of wine. The wardrobe door would not open because it was close to the bed and the bathroom you couldnt turn around in. The bed was two singles pushed together. We went down to reception to complain. There were no apologies and we were told all the fridges had been removed for safety! This was annoying as we had brought sandwiches for a day off which we planned to keep in the fridge. So we got moved to a "bigger room" and that was all. Room 2- This room was tinier! It had an actual double bed but same small flowers and fruit. It had 3 cans of coke (room 1 had 2) but no safety box, damp dressing gowns, no slippers and the room was so dark. There were hairs in the bathroom which was bigger but we still felt this was not the 4* room we had bought. Looking at the room paln on the back of the door all the rooms around us were bigger. so back down we went again! Reception didnt apologise and said these were there biggest rooms!!! We stayed in a holiday inn express in Hamilton that was 3 times as big for half the price. I know London hotels are smaller but ive been in larger 2* rooms! Room 3- Room 3 was not much bigger but had better lighting. The bed was 2 singles pushed together. But this room had 2 bottles of wine! We settled because we were too tired to keep fighting. We could open the wardrobe and the bathroom was slightly bigger. We went out and brought back a pizza to find the microwave was broken and the plug said it was last tested 2008! Went to ask for a new one to be told sorry...we can heat it up inn kitchen..which defeats the point!!!! In the morning i looked for the hair dryer to find it missing.I rang reception who told me it was in the drawer so i said it wasn't and i wanted it asap. I was greeted by a bus boy who didnt say good morning simply went "there WILL be one in your drawer and to return it asap!" HOW RUDE!!!! we left for the day and said a microwave better be waiting. To some up- They did replace the microwave but that was all. We had no slippers as advertised. Chocolates left on the bed at night happened 1 out of the 4 nights. Staff never really said hello or were helpful. The location is great, 5 min walk to paddington and the breakfast is good but if you want pastries get there early. Oh and they only have skimmed milk which means unless you like grey tea in the morning avoid! On check out we looked under the bed to find a pair of socs and lots of vanity items which really grossed us out! All 3 rooms were missing something from "the list" and this annoyed us. Some rooms had 5 pieces of fruit, some had 3 cans, some 2 bottles of wine, some had a hairdryer, some had wine glasses, some had bathroom scales, some safety boxes. The point is ALL rooms should have the same (all the club rooms). Oh yes the club lounge is a small "ailse" with a few chairs and a computor..hardly exclusive feeling! The maid waited outside our room most days and dived in as we left which made us feel bad for wanting a lie in some days. Most the staff never apologised or greeted us and when we raised issues seemed to not care. For a 4* hotel this was a waste of money. Yes they have a few nice touches like a newspaper every morning but again this didnt happen every morning. I would spend your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, never ever tryit!”
Reviews.Author: TatariTehran
Reviews.Content: I booked a room well in advance with a "2-nights-free" offer through the hotel's website. UNBELIEVABLY, they refused checking me in although I had the confirmation of my booking! They had no explanation and kept saying :"I am sorry! We didn't do this deal!" The manager of a nearby hotel remembered that they had done it before to other people! They probably had given my room to a better money! Unbelievably unresponsible and unprofessional! Definitely never go back to any Shaftsbury!

Reviews.Title: “Location & location only !”
Reviews.Author: Tillker
Reviews.Content: My experience with the hotel was relatively Bad. A bachlelor room is glorified prison cell with almost no room for mobility. Everything is cramped, and i could barely fit into the shower cell. Service was incosistent, and had stuff left behind by room service !! If youre looking for a good hotel experience, AVOID IT !! LOCATION was a strong point ... Hyde park is a minutes walk, and 2 subway stations are minutes away......

Reviews.Title: “good quiet location and executive rooms good value”
Reviews.Author: gaffelaar
Reviews.Content: I booked an executive room here because the standard ones are really tiny. The hotel and the room has had a recent and stylish makeover and everything was clean and well maintained. The room was quiet and large and so was the newly fitted bathroom. Location is good, a short walk from Paddington and there are lots of different restaurants , cafes and small shops nearby so all very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Can a shower be any smaller”
Reviews.Author: grahamfettes
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful,ckeck in no problem all looked good until we went into the room. The room was very small the bed seemed to take up most of the room but at least the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable and the room had a large screen T.V not bad you think until you go into the shower room at first it looked fine then the surprise I think the smallest shower in the world, my wife who is five feet tall and of normal weight and she found it difficult to get in and out, think of the trouble I had six feet tall and 15st paint your own picture. One last thing don,t drop the soap in the shower as it is almost impossible to bend down to get it. WHAT A SHAME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Adamam
Reviews.Content: I was in London for 4 days , leaving on the 4th of October , but i decided to stay for 3 more days , and i couldn't extend my stay in the hotel i was staying in , so i looked for something near by and i found Padington court rooms which is a part of the the best western hotel , the rates were incredible , the hotel is 4 stars but the rate was better than 2 stars hotels nearby , our room was 633 , the only downside on the court rooms that there is no elevator and you have to take the stairs , we were on the third floor , but once we were on the room we were amazed , the size is huge compared to all the other hotels in central London , very clean room , cozy bed , spotless bathroom , free internet , in room kettle , after staying in another hotel nearby , this hotel easily tops it and it is much cheaper , and the location is amazing just a few minutes walk from paddington , would i go there again , absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Stay away- bed bug investation coverup”
Reviews.Author: ExeterGraham123
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Best Western on the 4th October after a long day of business training. After being led to my room by a dishevelled, greasy haired, itchy looking fellow without very much English in his vocabulary, began to settle into my room when I noticed a bug on the ceiling and the shell of an insect on the window sill. I called reception to tell them, and at the same time took advantage of their free wi-fi to take a look at recent reviews of the hotel. Bed-bug reports were present. Reception called back and I alerted them of my concerns. They assured me they did not have a problem with bed-bugs (although later admitted that their other rooms in the building across the street had had a bed-bug problem that they had 'taken care of'). They offered to move me to another room regardless, which I accepted. I undertook a thorough inspection of the new room and found a live bed-bug, which I duly took upstairs to reception and showed the hotel manager. There was some surreptitious glances between staff and managers, a whispered conversation, and then the manager asked me to go outside for a chat. I insisted on being moved from the building, was offered a room at a sister hotel around the corner, refused, was offered a room at the Best Western Kensington, reluctantly accepted this 'final offer'. I glanced with sympathy at the happy customers still entering the lobby to check in, wishing I had the courage to warn them. Enroute to the Kensignton Best Western l I googled reviews of this hotel and found similar reports. I got out of the cab and stayed at a friends house. I believe this hotel chain is denying rampant reports of the infestation. Their efforts to control the problem have obviously been unsuccessful and night after night innocent victims sleep in their infected beds and carry the bugs back to their houses and families. Spread the word- this hotel chain should be shut down! Their behaviour is disgusting, their actions are based on pure greed, and their victims number in the hundreds, if not thousands. Do not stay at this hotel under any circumstances. Even without the bugs, the quality of the rooms was poor. Damp, cramped and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room and shower room”
Reviews.Author: shirmun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at beginning of october, first impression at reception was good. hotel building is old.Rooms are really reallly small..da shower room is the smallest i have ever seen.It was a struggle to get in and out off the shower without getting stuck in the door..Close to paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “Foreign Manager & staff - terrible - moved me to a different hotel without informing me”
Reviews.Author: seasidestar
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Paddington, at 6.45pm. I was going to watch Blood Brothers the musical at 7.30pm, so was looking for a quick check in. It took the hotel staff 10 minutes just to attend to me, only to find out that i wasn't even going to be staying in the hotel. Someone at the reception told me " your block of rooms have plumbing issues, but don't worry because we are moving you to another hotel"- i explained, i did not have time to go to another hotel ( as i had to wait on a taxi and it was 5 minutes away, to the other hotel.) so i had to leave my case behind the reception and run off to the theatre which was 25mins away. On the way back from the theatre, it was the worst rain i had ever seen, and i got stuck right in it, without a jacket. as it was in my case. So i got back to the hotel Soaking wet, you would think i had walked in a shower with my clothes on. I was standing their dripping wet, and the recption kept stalling me and leaving me waiting over phone calls. this really pissed me off. i then had to wait 10 minutes for a taxi. I got sent to another hotel which wasn't of the same standard. I paid for breakfast but was not allowed breakfast at the new hotel. I then had to get a taxi back to the paddington court best western, to complain to the manager. Out comes a Manager from Pakistan - who was completely of no use to me and called me a liar. i did not get the breakfast fee returned and it put a downer on my whole trip. Would not reccomend at all... seriously , i would of stayed back at the hotel if they actually done something to resolve or appolgise for the f******* inconvience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: shucita2812
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Best Western Paddington Court,Location was fantastic, walkng distance from Paddington and lancaster gate station. check in was very quick, luggage porter was very helpful offered me help with the bags, reception staff was friendly and upgraded me to the double room.Room was not very big but good value of money.Breakfast was costly so did not have at the hotel. Would definaltely come back

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night last week on business. We had to queue for 10 minutes to check in and I was given a room you could not swing a cat in, with broken air conditioning and no space to even put my suitcase. I'm not a big girl but there was barely room to walk round the bed in order to go and open the window. The bathroom was also absolutely tiny, with a wash basin so impractical there was nowhere to balance your toothpaste. I was woken at 3.45am by a group of drunk youngesters in black tie, expecting a guy called Olly to come to the door rather than an irate, tired woman. Whilst this isn't the hotel's fault, their loud and slow progress down the corridor after waking me up (a good 10 minutes) is just not acceptable. We pre paid for breakfast on arrival and it was ok, but not worth £12. Then when I went to check out, they tried to charge me again. Nobody on reception asked if I had enjoyed my stay and I had to ask them for a copy of the invoice as all they intended to give me was me credit card receipt. In all poor service, a tiny room, a poor value-for-money breakfast and a bad night's sleep. The only plus to this hotel is that it is a 5 minute walk to Paddington station/tube.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel - you could be moved !”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthDevonSam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night to be near to Paddington for an early train to Heathrow. On arrival at 10.00pm we were told we could not have our room as the air conditioning had broken down. We told them we did not require air conditioning but were told we had to move to another of their hotels IN KENSINGTON. We expained we had to get to Heathrow by Heathrow Express from Paddington but there was no alternative but for us to go to a Best Western Hotel in Kensington. On arrival there we checked in only to be told our room was not at that hotel but in an annex down the road and around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay EVER!! 1 hours sleep on the first night! Uncomfortable and noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Waddingtonswife
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this stay was the location, lots of local shops and restaurants and only a short walk to Paddington station. I booked this hotel through a company account and have stayed here before a couple of years ago (for leisure) without a problem. However, this stay was terrible. Check-in was fine and the porter was very nice and showed me to my room which was in a building opposite the main hotel. On the face of it the room seemed practical. However, my first concern was the fact the main door to the building was not secure and I had to walk up numerous flights of stairs to get to my room, not great for a lone female customer. I settled down for the night at around midnight only to be woken by party revellers returning to the hotel at 1am, this isn't unusual in London and I settled back down to return to sleep. However, this continued ALL night and groups of people gathered outside the Reception area opposite as well as underneath my building to smoke, they were drunk and noisy and no attempt to move people on quickly was made by hotel staff. One group would eventually move on, only to be replaced by another. The lumpy, cramped single bed exacerbated my frustration. This continued until 4am, at this time the linen delivery lorries arrived, and taxis and traffic started up. I had gone to London for business and this experience didn't set me up for an expensive, intense 3 day training course that ended with an exam! I made my complaints to Reception during the night, although I had to use the outside line as the internal line to Reception did not connect (they didn't charge me for this). However, they were unable to move me, pretty unsympathetic, and advised it would be dealt with the following morning, there was also no duty manager on call to escalate my problem to. The following day my company spoke with Reception and were advised the hotel couldn't move me without me being present (this contradicted the information from the previous night, and my luggage was packed ready). Upon returning to the hotel at 6pm they had assigned a room in the main hotel which overlooked the same busy Reception area and street. When I politely explained that this room was unsuitable too, the Reception staff were cold and impatient. They reluctantly assigned a further room, again in a building opposite, and the friendly porter took me across to look at it. The room faced a brick wall in the rear and was on the ground floor, brilliant...no noise!! My stay got better at this point but the room was small, the shower door was broken, the shower head was also broken and the previous occupants dirty towel was still in the made up room. The hot/cold indicators on the basin tap were the wrong way round, good job I was just cleaning my teeth otherwise I would have been scalded. Breakfast was lovely and I was in and out quickly. Staff were very pleasant, responsive and friendly in the restaurant. The only solice is that I wasn't paying for this experience personally (£140 per night I believe!) but I will be speaking to my company advising not to send my colleagues to this 4-star hotel (?!!? more like 2!!). I will be attending further courses in the same place but won't use this hotel again, and neither should you, it's certainly hit and miss and expensive to make that gamble!!

Reviews.Title: “wasnt that bad at all!! very helpful service”
Reviews.Author: dykesy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the paddington court shaftesbury and read the reviews the night before leaving, hoping we would be ok. on arrival(very near the station), we werent disappointed, the staff were very helpful.our room was same as, if not bigger than other hotels we have stayed in , and very tidy and clean etc. bottle of wine and coke along with fruit on arrival in the room. the room was airy and nice and clean. the staff the next day(porters) in the lobby were friendly and helped find our tourist attractions on the map. I cut my finger earlier and they supplied me with three plasters and alcohol wipes. They even looked after our bags as we went around london the following day before leaving at the nearby railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I had feared.....”
Reviews.Author: AndyB2008
Reviews.Content: Having read the horror stories on here I was a little apprehensive but when you are only spending £85 per night in London you can't expect much. We arrived at the booked "Shaftsbury London" and were registered and advised that our room was in another building and were taken there immediately - again sinking heart as I believe that this is a common thread on this forum and again people have been disappointed. We ended up in the Hyde Park Paddington - owned by the same people and were shown to our room. The room was definitely small and is no way a four star room however the fixtures, fittings and cleanliness were all of a high standard. The Air conditioning did not work but a couple of nudges at reception, a teaspoon and the unit being switched on in the roof void sorted this. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet and we both had good nights sleeps and one of the best hotel showers I have ever had. So in summary don't be put off too much by the reviews, sure its not four stars and would be better described as a good three star, they should really book you into the building you have actually booked but if you are paying less than £90 per night in such a fantastically convenient location you cannot expect much more than a clean room with a comfy bed......

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: haj1London
Reviews.Content: My booking was originally for Paddington Court Rooms, who upon arrival, informed us that our room was experiencing maintenance problems (no hot water) and that we would be upgraded to a better room at their sister hotel, Park Grand. However, my original booking was for an Executive room but we wanted to be sure that we got hot water so we walked over to the Park Grand. Upon entering the very small room, I was told that the manager of Paddington Court Rooms had NOT upgraded us to a better room and definitely not equalled it to an Executive room, as I had requested, but we were given a deluxe room (which was as small as a rabbit hutch and in which my bedroom at home was bigger than the entire room and toilet). We walked back over to Paddington Court Rooms and were told that we could get an Executive room and that there wasn't any maintenance problems (all very puzzling). The executive room we were shown was awful, old and tiny - definitely not worthy of the name! So, we had to settle with our deluxe room - 1) the room we had not asked for and 2) in another hotel. I would not stay at either of these hotels again or in fact a Best Western - I think their internet prices are a big scam to get bookings because once you are there, you have no choice but to take what you are being given. BUT the breakfast was very nice, best bit of our stay! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews completely over-dramatic, perfectly good stay here”
Reviews.Author: shellywoodles
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying in the Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington in Devonshire Terrace and I have to say it was a perfectly good stay!!! Travelled with my boyfriend to tour London for three days. Booked through lastminute.com. After reading some of the reviews on here I got a serious scare, was dreading going!! but when we arrived, we were checked in speedily and shown to our room across the road from reception. Room was small but not so small that it ruined our trip!! bed good, bathroom good...shower good and hot and good power. Towels replaced every day. Little or no noise at night time too....Paddington station is sooo close, perfect for the heathrow express and tube staions into piccadilly and oxford st. Overall, very satisfactory!!! :) would definetly go back. Ideal for tourists...maybe not for big families. Some of these reviews are way mis-leading. You are hardly going over to London to sit in your room anyway so it was perfect :)

Reviews.Title: “An insult to the Best Western brand”
Reviews.Author: PTFrost
Reviews.Content: Decided to pay for upgrade to find that promised facilities (fridge, fruit, complementary drinks, bathrobe etc) were not there. WiFi did not work and the room was tiny compared to others at similar rated hotels. The fire alarm went off continually during the night (- bad luck or bad maintenance?) and the guests were not offered any alternative accommodation whilst the problem was fixed. The next morning the manager promised me personally that he would reduce my bill, and promised me a reduced rate the next time I stayed. Over a month later and my credit card bill shows no reduction and I have heard nothing back about the reduced price offer for next time. The last issue is no problem for me as I'd need a threat of physical violence to induce me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “awful.”
Reviews.Author: ClareHilda
Reviews.Content: useless staff especially receptionist - 2 weeks before i filled out all the forms to prepay hotel for my parents - heard nothing back - assumed all was ok - they arrived at hotel to say there was no facility to prepay - yet we followed their instructions - so my parents had to pay 300e - so much for it being a present!! Hotel rang me after they checked out saying it was an oversight on their part - emails werent updated - so they leave emails for 2 weeks untouched!!!! they ruined the stay - were rude on the phone and rude to my parents!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Shaftburys!”
Reviews.Author: spainflyer
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms on Hotwire for a 4 star hotel in the Notting Hill – Bayswater area of London. The only 4 stars listed were the Hilton Metropole and Hilton Paddington, and I expected to get one of those. I was very wrong! Hotwire has added at least the Shaftsbury Hyde Park International, at 52-55 Inverness Terrace, to its list of 4 stars in this area. From all appearances it is NOT a four star but don’t know for sure since we were turned away at 6 pm on a Saturday afternoon although we held a printed paid booking, with the explanation that “a boiler has broken and since you didn’t book directly with the hotel, you’ll have to call your travel agent” to sort out the situation. About twenty minutes of back and forth resulted in an offer to put us up at another “Shaftsbury 4 star” nearby, the Best Western Shaftsbury Paddington Court. An offer was made to get us a car service but we were warned that this would talk at least a half hour. After waiting the half hour, we were ready to walk to the new hotel with our luggage, when the car showed up and drove us quickly to the Best Western Shaftsbury. Things went downhill from here. The Best Western Shaftsbury is listed as a 4 star hotel, even by AA (the British equivalent of AAA) who should know better. Like the Shaftsbury Hyde Park International – where we were unable to stay – it is a converted row house in an entire street of perhaps 20 or 25 conversions serving as modest two- and three-star hotels. How the two Shaftsburys got to be listed as four stars is beyond me. Although the experience overall was very disappointing, the pertinent details here are that we were again given rooms with single beds, mine measured approximately 2.5 metres by 3 metres (about 8 feet by 10) barely enough room for the bed and for the door to open. There was no lift / elevator to our rooms on the first (US second) floor, so we lugged our bags up. The air conditioning in my room did not work and the window in the bathroom opened only a crack. The dirty window in the room did not open at all. The carpet was threadbare and the bathroom, which had been outfitted with a new, plastic shower stall too small to bend over in, was tiny, with the sink slightly larger than an A-4 sheet of paper. From what we could tell, the guests at this hotel are backpackers and tour groups. When we were there a busload of about 50 people from Holland checked in, and there were several scruffy but polite backpackers waiting to use the one computer hooked up to the Internet. The staff were all immigrants, which is fine as long as they don’t bring some of their more disagreeable customs with them. When we checked out early on Monday morning, a member of staff offered to get a taxi for us. Since we were right next to a main road with plenty of taxis we told him that wouldn’t be necessary. Nevertheless he barged out into the road, stopped the first cab and had a brief exchange of conversation. When we got into the cab the driver told us “He wanted me to pay him for bringing me clients! Baksheesh in Central London!!”

Reviews.Title: “Too small and too disorganized for the price charged”
Reviews.Author: TatevikD
Reviews.Content: I spent about a week at this hotel in December 2009 while traveling to London for business. I have booked my room on-line, and was hoping to get a disant room in a disant location. The location was all right close to Underground stations, however if I were to return to London for exploring it central location by foot I would not choose to stay at this location again. Now, the room, for which I paid 120 pounds a night was not just small, it was tiny!! It has a wierd smell, and almost no light in it, as the window of my room was overlooking a a building which was 5 metrs away. The rooms did not have central heating and I had to turn on the AC for heating the room. After a day the AC stoped working, when I asked for someone to come and fix it, I was told that the problem cannot be fixed and I was provided with a heater, which indeed could not keep my room very warm, + the bathroom and toiliet were separted from my room with a small hallway, so the heat did not really get there! People working at reception, however were nice and helpful, that was the only nice thing about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: TiggerWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Female receptionist hostile on checking in. Given room on second floor superior double?? very small, and smelt musty, exchanged rooms without difficulty the only difference no smell and slightly bigger however some light switches didnt work, bulbs gone in lamps, shower fills up so you have to wait until the water has gone before you can get out of the shower, towel rail pretty much on the ceiling not reachable if under 5ft 2 tall, not that you would want to use them as they are a dirty white. Booked in for 2 nights left after one. Would not recommend to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Inferior, not superior, room”
Reviews.Author: dnw_10
Reviews.Content: A grotty little room on the top (third) floor in a building opposite the hotel. Access to the room was via narrow, steep stairs, There was no lift. Very noisy due to A/C units on the roof. Dripping shower head in a "bathroom" the size of a small cupboard.Tatty room, very poky, it was impossible to walk around the bed. The main hotel might have all the fancy stuff as advertised (room service, wi-fi etc) but if you're in the manky annex there is nothing. If you're after a romantic trip this is NOT the hotel for you. Definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Only visit this hotel if you can live in a shoebox!”
Reviews.Author: Mikewm8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely situated and well-served by transport links. The main problem is the size of the rooms and the bathroom in particular; we had a 'deluxe double'. The room was so small that I had difficulty in passing the end of the bed without resorting to using my hands on the bed; the bed was a double, but only just and being 6' 2" tall, my feet overhung the bottom. The en-suite bathroom was so small that when you opened the door, you had to stand at the side of the toilet to close it again. I was only just able to squeeze through the doors into the shower cubicle and would suggest that anybody who ways more than 16 stones, would not be able to get in at all. In arrival, I noticed that the toilet seat was loose and reported it to the Receptionist who wrote my room number on a scrap of paper and promised that somebody would fix it. I asked about this on two further occasions but by the time we checked out, this still had not been fixed. Other than the location, the other good point was the self-service breakfast although it could be a bit of a scrum at certain times.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: hm_hoetger
Reviews.Content: rooms, service, waiters, receoption, had to carry luggage up and down endless stairs back and to reception since card lock never worked, elevator only going up (?), fire alarm system failing - alarms from midnight to 3 am in various frequencies.... Never ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Runninguy1011
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the Trip Advisor reviews before booking but as I was travelling alone and I know the hotel is in a great location I thought "how bad could it be"? The service was initially friendly but the guy kept trying to carry my bags to the room despite my repeated refusal. He clearly was focussed on getting a tip. The lift was not big enough for two people and a bag. The room was very small. The hotel has been modernised in a 'paper over the cracks' sort of a way. The shower door was broken. The shaver power point was faulty. The bedside lamp was broken. And the highlight? A big fat bed bug full of blood from its feast on the previous occupant. After a lenghty queue to check out with a crowd of unhappy looking fellow guests, my heart lept with joy as I trundled off to my next destination.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't swing a cat in here...but”
Reviews.Author: stowgirl33
Reviews.Content: the rooms are ok if you want a base for 2 nights max, within easy reach of Paddington. They've been refurbed and the refurb is ok - use of space is actually quiet clever but the rooms are so small that I was unable to walk around the bottom of the bed without falling onto it. They provide you with an iron and ironing board which is great but its a real challenge to put them up ( I stayed in 2 rooms both had broken ironing boards) . The bar is well worth a visit for the odd barman who served me up a bottle of red wine out of the fridge and them was quite put out when I asked for one not out of the fridge. I wouldnt pay full price for this place but for a cheapy on last minute I think its location makes up for it. Warning - if you are male and tall then you'll never get into the shower cubicles!!

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Calford2
Reviews.Content: Check in was the most painful experience we have endured in a long time. The staff appeared completely incompetent and quite arrogant. It took around 25 mins. Room was adequate - but having booked it as a "secret hotel" we were going to be put in the basement! No air con on a very hot night.....Bar not open until 6.00 pm...Go anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny superior room in basement - DO NOT BELIEVE LASTMINUTE.COM”
Reviews.Author: JZDWales
Reviews.Content: I booked a superior room and was hugely dissappointed. If I am to be fair, the appointment of the room was OK. Clean, fairly comfortable, but the room was tiny and in the basement. I felt like I was on a boat because of the noise, cramped conditions and heat. I couldn't open the wardrobe or sit at the desk because of their proximity to the bed. As a business traveller on a budget this was not a place I would go back to. For one night it was enough, but if you value space over freebies save your money and book a Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “£100 per night for a room in the basement !!”
Reviews.Author: pauleka7
Reviews.Content: We chose to ignore the bad reviews when we booked a room in this hotel but we shouldn't have ! We arrive at 5 p.m to the hotel to check in and they told us that the only rooms available were in the basement ! We booked a double room and were given a room with twin beds with absolutely no view and no direct light ! The room was cold, dark and gloomy. We went to the reception to claim a room with a double bed and not in the basement, and they showed us an other room with twin beds again ! From our arrival, we were treated like idiots but not proper customers. When we went again to the reception, they finally upgrade us to a suite room in the hotel across the street ! The staff wasn't polite and the first room we were given was definitely not worth the price ! Avoid this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large selection of rooms”
Reviews.Author: dirtybluejeans
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 4-5 times now, and the best thing about this is the location. It's a 5-minute walk from Paddington Station, so if you land at Heathrow, you can reach Paddington in 15 minutes, and the hotel in another 5. It's also a few minutes away from Lancaster Gate tube station, which is right in front of Hyde Park /Kensington Gardens. Just 15 minutes away by tube from the heart of shopping: Oxford/Regent Street. The room range is very vast. While they offer only 2-3 types, there's a huge variation within each type (they cost the same, it's just your luck). While the staff are very courteous, they do tend to take you for a ride by overbooking/ giving you a smaller room, and hoping you won't notice/complain. Ive always booked a Double Superior/Deluxe room, but have been sold a crappy single room slightly bigger then a cabinet. I complained, and was moved to a far bigger room the next day. Make it a point to complain specially if you are going to be there for a few days. The rooms themselves (assuming you go for a double deluxe or better) are nice and clean. The beds are very comfortable, and there's free wired broadband in every room (if you are on the lower floors, you may get the wifi signal from the reception). The rooms have LCD TV with IPTV connections, with about 30 FTA channels already available. My room had a coffee/tea maker, hair dryer, and ironing board as well. Other than the bed, there's a small writing table and chair. These rooms are good for yourself, but if you plan to invite someone over, you will probably need to get a bigger room - or meet in the lounge/bar. The hotel provides free toiletries which are fairly decent: one tends to use a lot of moisturizers in London, specially during winters, and their's isn't too bad. There was a bathtub in the attached bathroom in the room I had.. and lots of clean towels, replaced everyday by efficient housekeeping were provided. The breakfast (sometimes included - you'll need to confirm before you eat!!!) is not all that great, and a bit overpriced (about 17 pounds including VAT). You can eat a helluva lot more for that money, and your choice of foods too. For vegetarians, there's very limited stuff, and vegans are basically screwed. The room service can be really, really pathetic - I once ordered food from a takeaway, and then a plate and fork from the hotel, and the food came in much before the plate. All in all, a value for money hotel, but you will get a good deal only by insisting for it. But when you do, you will probably find it to have been a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Rooms are like a closet”
Reviews.Author: jodimgolf
Reviews.Content: The standard room are like a closet and some are located across the street from the main hotel. Stay away from those rooms!

Reviews.Title: “This one scores on its location!”
Reviews.Author: Rach1809
Reviews.Content: I have had multiple stays in this hotel in last 4 months and like it because of its central location which is quite close to my work place in Paddington. Rooms are neat and clean, staff is friendly. However, what sucks about this hotel is the room size and the internet connection. Rooms are really tiny..in fact, my first room was so tiny that I had to go for an upgrade. Internet connection is really slow and keeps going on and off. There are many restaurants in the close vicinity. Overall, I would say it's value for money in Central London.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING SERVICE - AVOID AT ALL COSTS !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoobede
Reviews.Content: I am still fuming over this place 4 days after staying there. I booked a one night stay through Hotels.com (dont get me started on them either!!!!) and I requested a 12.30 check in as we had a wedding to go to, all was fine, confirmation sent through. Got there, ha ha ha, guess what NO RECORD OF BOOKING !!! was met with a young lady who couldnt have been ruder, telling me it was too early to check in then saying we had no room, meanwhile because of faffing around we got a parking fine, they eventually found us a room, told us we could have a complimentary bottle of wine (which never appeared) then the nect day which was a Sunday the vacuum cleaners started at 7am!!!! Check out was a treat, we were behind about 17 people all complaining. DONT EVER EVER GO TO THIS HOLE !!!!!! ITS NOT EVEN CLEAN AND THE BREAKFAST IS VILE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in anywhere in the world...”
Reviews.Author: chikaraPortugal
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind that the full room rate is supposedly £295.00 per night, the following happened to me.... - At the time of making my booking, I said that I would arrive at 10pm. I needed to change my check in time to midnight, so I decided to phone ahead to advise, as I was concerned about arriving so late with the possibility of my room being given to somebodey else. Upon calling the hotel, I received a very abrupt staff member who repeatedly said that the reception was open 24 hours a day and that there was no need to advise. She would not take any details from, not even my name just to appease me. - Upon arrival at midnight, after not eating all day and travelling for about 6 hours, the staff told me that they had no record of my confirmation of stay. Fortunately I had a copy of my confirmation from the website I booked it on. I then had to wait while the very unprofessional reception staff kept running out the back to sort everything out with the Duty Manager. I may as well have been standing at the counter of McDonalds. I then asked if the hotel had anywhere that I could eat, even if only a snack and I was told there were no facilities but I could order a take-away pizza! - 1/2 an hour later my room was sorted out. They told me that my booking had not been updated in their system which is why they couldn't find out, despite my confirmed booking being made 3 days earlier. - The staff at check in did not tell me of any of the the facilities at the hotel or any near by attractions. I asked if I could arrange a late check out for the next day, (only an hour was required), only to receive the response, "Late check out, what is a late check out"? I then had to explain to the staff what is was. When I told them, they said there was no problem and that I could check out an hour later the following day. - The room was already prepaid but they requested a further £10.00 for incidentals after they had just told me that I could not obtain any food or drinks in the room or at their bar area. Of course if I wanted breakfast, that would be extra so what could I possibly accrue another £10.00 worth of incidentals on? - The room, although having nice decor, was ridiculously small. I was tripping myself and I was the only one in there. The room I had was allegedly the, "club double room", this means that it's supposed to be on eof their biggest rooms. I wouldn't want to see what a single room looks like. I had to sit on the toilet to reach the rubbish bin that was under the sink in the bathroom. The shower was extremely small, if you're a tall or wide person you might be able to get in there but good luck moving your body around trying to have a wash. - There was some complimentary tea, coffee, drinks, biscuits and fruit in the room but nobody told me that they were complimentary.
