Everything was also at room temperature, as there wasn't a mini fridge/ minibar in the room. - By this time, it was now about 1:30am, so I went off to wonder the streets of Paddington looking for something to eat. - Next morning, the Cleaner is knocking on my door at 12:01pm. Through the door I explained that I had a late check and that I would be ready in about 20 minutes, to which I received a response of, "okay". Then literally 3 minutes later, I had a knock on the by the Duty Manager asking me if I was checking out today! I told her that I had arranged a late check out with reception the night before to which she said she wasn't informed. Never again will I stay in the 2 star hotel! The staff are a joke and so are the rooms. I cannot possibly how this hotel has a 4 star rating, other than the decor in the rooms being quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: mccoyster
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 of my friends stayed in this hotel recently. When booking we requested single beds in the rooms and the rooms to be on the same floor and since we had booked months in advance we expected our requests to be met. When we got there the 2 rooms were on different floors and they said they would change one of the rooms the next day, inconvenient but we had no other choice. We nearly died when we got to the rooms they both had tiny double beds in them (not what we requested), the furniture was very out dated and you couldnt swing a cat in the rooms they were that small. Neither of our tv's worked properly. On the second day in one of the rooms the roof started leaking in the bathroom right over the shower then the sink was leaking underneath. We complained and requested to be moved and also to be moved down to the same floor as our friends and when we got back that day they had moved us to the room next door to our original room. The only helpful people in the place were the porters who always had a smile for you. I dont have a clue how this place got a 4 star rating I think its pushing it at a 2 star rating. I would never go back to this hotel EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid avoid!”
Reviews.Author: BruthP
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hostels and tents for years and are therefore not unfamiliar to "slumming it"!! However, when faced with 2 nights at this Best Western Hotel we were absolutely flabbergasted how terrible everything was. This is the first time we have ever felt strongly enough to report our stay to Trip Advisor to warn fellow bargain-hunters to avoid this place! It was also the 1st place in my whole life I have requested a room change (though I shouldn't have bothered as the 2nd one was equally bad!) Right from arrival to departure we experienced terrible service, with the small exception of 2 staff members (Aruna @reception & Carlo @breakfast who were the only ones who smiled!). Everyone else working there looked like they'd rather be anywhere else than there, and several were downright rude for no good reason (both to each other & to ourselves & other guests). Rooms were smaller than small, noise was terrible; the first night our toilet contantly flushed & dripped and our bed should have been replaced years ago. We actually had to hang on to the sides of the mattress to avoid falling down a big dip in the middle of it! The bathrooms were tiny - my husband's no bigger than average but actually had to step out of the shower cubicle to lather up! Also the towels were out of reach for anyone less than 5'4", high up on shelving in the miniscule bathroom. To add insult to injury my husband's wheelchair got taken hostage and locked in the luggage room without our consent!!! Incidentally, definitely avoid if you have ANY sort of mobility problems. Steps everywhere, tiny "rabbit warren" corridors & corners. To that matter, avoid anyway. Shocking.

Reviews.Title: “Ruthless Gougers”
Reviews.Author: Wonder_10
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in London during the volcano eruption. My daughter and I shared a deluxe double room. The rooms were extremely small but clean and the hotel demanded payment in advance, which I found to be a little strange. Considering our situation though, we were happy to have a room. However, our situation appeared to be an opportunity for the hotel to up their rates daily. We stayed four nights and every night the rate increased. When it appeared we would have to stay longer, I asked what the rate would be. The desk clerk fumbled around a bit, and then said he couldn't tell me the rate until I booked it. Not believing what I was hearing,I asked if that meant giving him my credit card and actually booking it, and he said yes. Unbelievable! Fortunately, I managed to find a flight out and did not have to stay there another night. I think I would have made an effort to find another hotel though. The staff was rude and during our entire time there, we did not see one person crack a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Would expect much more from a 4star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Tomto147
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are extremely small. Nice bathroom but also ca 2 m2. The location is the best part of the deal. 100pounds a night is far to much for the quality you get... my 3g mobile connection was 3 times faster then hotel's "broadband"

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 89tinker89
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel,good location minutes walk from tube,stayed in club double as reviews have said rooms are small, the club double wasn't exatly a big hotel room but was fine for two nights stay, would recommend staying in club double as saw a deluxe double and was small would be had to move about in the room. The only downside was the shower had to step into shower sideways as was very small. Would stay in Hotel again for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “wanna laundry louse? go to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: agfounder
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 nights. on the second night my spouse discovered red dots on the skin. And the more we stayed in the room that evening - the more bites appeared on the skin. The hotel staff changed our room for better one for the last night, but anyway - all my wife's body is covered with bites and now we have to boil all the clothes we had. sheeeeeet... have you ever heard of 4* european hotel with LOUSES?! gawd! actually the hotel is 2-3* at the maximum. Shower cabin details are falling apart; water temperature lever was broken, sound isolation iz zero - we heard everything our neighbours did :) And in the evening TVs in rooms are automatically made lower in sound - so that it's impossible to hear anything even sitting half a meter in front of TV :) what a leisure! never ever stop in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “had a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: lintyloo
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel. Booked a 'club room' the day before arrival via their website so got a very good discount. We weren't expecting much but the room was fabulous - modern and clean, although a little small. Bed was comfy (with lots of pillows!) and the bathroom was very modern with a very nice shower and bath. Location was perfect, within walking distance (through Hyde Park) to Victoria and of course Paddington Station. The hotel looked after our luggage for us for a couple of hours before we could check in which was good. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for business purposes as convenient location”
Reviews.Author: h0liday2010
Reviews.Content: shower has no power at all, very very small rooms, good central location

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very accommodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnieboo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times since the start of the year and have always had good service. Check in was always quick and painless, there was always a room available for us and the staff were always friendly and helpful. The Location is great. Plenty of places to eat in the area. Lots of transport options... 3 underground stations, 1 rail station and lots of buses within 5-10 minutes walk. Accomodation is good for London, Only one of our rooms was a bit small (413? I think) but it was still functional for a couple, we only slept there after all. Rooms 202 and 102 were good with plenty of storage but 102 had a blocked toilet and so we were moved into Clubroom 105 which had the biggest bed I have even slept in in a hotel. We had to extend our stay twice while in this room and although we kept booking a regular double they let us stay in the same room. During our stay we had some friends come to London and they were booked into single rooms but the hotel upgraded them into doubles. I never had breakfast at the hotel, I don't agree with paying roughly £12 for breakfast when cafes around Paddington Station will do it for less than £5. Overall I would recommend this hotel. Currently I am staying in what has to be the worse hotel in London and would give anything to be back at Paddington Court.

Reviews.Title: “Average for price”
Reviews.Author: pahari75
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good location and friendly, though not very professional, staff. Negatives: Tiny rooms, expensive buffet and very ordinary bar

Reviews.Title: “No warm welcome here”
Reviews.Author: hotel_critique777
Reviews.Content: originally we were supposed to stay at another hotel, but they hotel was booked so we were refered to the shaftesbury best western( as they were owned as a chain) The staff were very rude upon arrival, We spent $1000AU for 6 nights acomodation, and they made an error with our booking and were determined to deny us a room. The staff lied and said there were no rooms avaliable, and practically told us there was no room for us! nearly having a a heartattack, because of how much money we had on the booking, my partner spoke to the manager who still denied us a room claiming because we were a little late it was a no show! outraged my partner asked to speak to someone higher then him, and after much argument and anger, all of a sudden! a room magically appears after they told us there were no rooms at all for us. Throughout this time, all we got from the staff were death stares and a feeling of unease and no wlecome at all.They gave us a small little cubboard of a room, which was ok considering i did not want to loose my money, then we upgraded to a club room for the last night. I wouldnt stay at this shaftesbury again, the staff are the representation of the hotel body, and the way they were all acting ad handling the situation was incompetent, it gave me reason to describe this hotel having a bad reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for 4 nights. Told no room available on arrival at 20.30!!”
Reviews.Author: Eversearching
Reviews.Content: Booked for 4 nights at this hotel for two people. Arriving at 20.30 after two and a half hours travel, was told that no rooms were available. Would put us up at nearby hotel - Hyde Park Premier. Apologised for inconveience and would arrange complimentary bottle of wine at new hotel. I made two prompt phone calls for the wine. Wine arrived at midnight with one glass. The Hyde Park Premier is very basic. Suggest that the Shaftebury Hotels are only booked as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms but excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Yosoylatina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property March 15 - 17. I booked it on Booking.com for 158 pounds total for a studio suite. I knew going in that European hotel rooms are typically small so I purposely booked a studio suite in hopes it would be larger. Well, it wasn't. The room had a king bed, which filled 90% of the room. The poor bellboy almost killed himself trying to get my huge suitcase in the room! Bless his soul. It was hard to maneuver around the room but once I got it down to a science, it was not a problem. I was located off the main property and put in a building across the street, which may bother some people but did not bother me as the staff was more than willing to help me get my bags across the street to my room. Room had a nice size fridge and there were some fruit there as well as some milk in the fridge -- nice touch! There were plates, cups and utensils available as well as dishwasher detergent to wash your dishes. The best features were the shower and the free broadband internet. The shower was one of the best showers I have ever experienced. It had that rainforest feature where the water pours down overhead. There were also blue lights to put in the dark so you can see your way in there in the middle of the night, Wonderful! Internet was easy to hook up - just plugged in the wire to my laptop. The TV was a nice flat screen, which I watched at bedtime and in the morning as I drank my coffee. Location is great. There was a little supermarket around the corner, Paddington is 5 blks away, and newsstand around the corner where I purchased drinks and my pass for the bus and underground. Many restaurants along Craven Terrace that were better priced than hotel and great food. I ate lunch at the Craven Cafe, which was great. And if you walk up Craven Terrace to Bayswater Road, you will find an entrance to Hyde Park, where you can sit by the fountain and eat lunch on a nice day. Also, many buses run along Bayswater Road. I took one to Marble Arch to shop and was there in 5 minutes. Lancaster Gate tube station was also a few blocks from Craven Terrace and Bayswater Road. I would definitely stay here again, Cost 45 pounds to take a taxi from the hotel to Heathrow, which I thought was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed in every area”
Reviews.Author: VincentMarquez
Reviews.Content: We booked a one-night stay online because we were in London for the worshipcentral conference at Westminster Central Hall. First off we were delighted at the price, fully £10 cheaper than a room-only stay at the Battersea Travelodge and much closer to where we wanted to be. We booked a Superior Double room and were surprised to find it had two double beds in it! This was great though, if unnecessary, because it meant the room was very spacious. There was a 30-inch-ish flat screen TV that displayed a 'Welcome [YOUR NAME HERE]' page and free internet access through the TV. The room decor was lovely, everything up to date and the bathroom was great - clean, modern and without being huge - bigger than most hotel room en-suites I've experienced. We were on the fourth floor, so very little street noise. Room had air-conditioning system (that we could control), ethernet internet connection and microwave. Service in the hotel was fantastic - attentive and helpful. Free newspaper in the morning at the time I requested. Restaurant was nice, breakfast buffet was superb - continental (including cereals, french bread, fruit, ham, cheese, yoghurt, pastries) and cooked (hot and delicious). I can't understand the poor reviews of this place! Next time we're staying in London we'll be booking in at the Paddington Court!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Pete
Reviews.Content: I expected the rooms to be pretty small when I checked in, and indeed they were. It was difficult to move around the bed without hitting the TV, and I had to move furniture around in order to put my luggage out of the way. The bathroom was very small, you could not open the door completely, as it hit the toilet seat, and the shower would be very small for a bigger person. The water pressure was also low in the shower. The food at breakfast was ok, but not fit for a 4 star hotel. On the up side, the personnel (only made up of east European and Indian people), was very polite and willing to help. They carried my luggage upstairs and did their best to fulfill my every request. The room was comfortable enough and there was free broadband internet that worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mad_scot33
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is never a 4 star. Great location 5 mins from Paddington Station but that is where good comments end. You can only get a drink up to 11pm in a bar that seats about 10 people and is only manned by whoever is available at that time. Ordered a sandwich in afternoon and told not possible because refrigerators were locked until 6pm. Rooms were clean but very small. I had upgrade to Club Room which was ok for me but would be hopeless for 2 people. No facilities other than rooms. Staff not very helpful once you found one that could understand you. Wouldn't stay here again if it was the last hotel in London

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: flash082
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews were not expecting a lot from this hotel. However we were very surprised at how good it was. Reception was very busy when we arrived howeverthey were very efficent and we did not have to wait to long to check in. Luckily for us on check in we were upgraded to a suite which was in another building just across the road. Fantastic room can't praise it enough. Only downside was the wait for breakfast dining room is not big enough for the amount of people . However when we did get in the buffet breakfast was really good. This hotel is great value for money. Would stay there again if we were in London.

Reviews.Title: “Allegedy a 4 star, more Appropriately a 0 star”
Reviews.Author: ZZZZZZZZZZZIrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace; 4 star hotel, but unable to get a drink at 12 o'clock midnight Cold breakfast in basement room Broken chair in bedroom 'Club' room - supposedly higher quality, but actually in dingy basement, view of concrete wall, no daylight Dripping water outside window all night, it was like chinese torture Small, small room - supposed to be a double, insufficient room for 1 Unable to turn off bedside lights, in the end I had to take out light bulbs Do not stay here at any cost

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London, easy access to station and to good eats for good prices”
Reviews.Author: kpb1nv
Reviews.Content: It was a very clean room. Very close to Paddington and Lancaster Gate stations, which also means very close to many 'off the tourist area' eats. Nice delis, mini groceries, etc. Got a room with a fridge (good sized for a hotel room) and a microwave, sink, hotpot etc. The bathroom had a heated floor and very modern and updated in general. Very nice bedding, the heater was a roll in though, so the whole room was not ever warm, just that one area was. We are ok sleeping in cold but others may not be. The 'suite' was downstairs, in the Basement actually I think. You looked out to this little cement area and 4 walls. Hard to explain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: liverpooljohnMold
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on a short trip to London. I booked through late rooms and was offered an upgrade to a club room for £125 per night. The room was spacious for a central London hotel. A queen size bed. Flat screen TV. Microwave discretly hidden away with crockery and cutlery for entertaining. Complementary half bottle of wine. Dressing gowns and slippers as well. For the money this was fantastic. The breakfast was included in the price - buffet style and a bit chaotic at busy time but the staff coped well and items were replenished as and when they ran out. I have stayed in a lot of hotels of this quality in London and they are all much the same - this one was better that average. It was very quiet at night and we both slept well with no noise disturbance. It is a bit further away from the attractions than I would have liked and while there are plenty of restaurants nearby there are no pubs.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY!!! But if you would like sleep with mouses, your choice”
Reviews.Author: zeynepsemmo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small too old and not clean!!! I don't want to talk much about bad experiences bu the most terrific thing a MOUSE ate my tshirt..There is nothing to say...

Reviews.Title: “AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: ShazDillon
Reviews.Content: Booked the Best Western Shaftsbury Paddington on a premier web site stating "4* Luxury Hotel with excellent location next to Paddington Street Station - LIES how does this company get away with distorting the truth!! On arrival at 10am on a Sat Morning just checking in for two nights and asked could we drop of the bags and head for the day the receptionist explained they had a broken boiler and would need to move us hotels - so they moved us to The Lancaster Gate Hotel - Woo hoo!!! what a hotel is was beautiful this is what I call 4* unfortunately we had to move back the next day to the Best Western - so pack up are stuff and headed back the next day!! What a downer :( From Luxury to a dump!!! They upgraded us to a Club Room for all our inconvenience this was a joke the room was a box! cobwebs in the corners, silver fish in the bathroom, TV did not work it was dark & dingy!! Paddinton Station was 10mins walk away. Don’t stay in this hotel if you are looking to stay in this area stay in The Lancaster Gate Hotel or The Hilton Paddington - from a 32 year old Irish Lass

Reviews.Title: “A Disgrace to the Hotel Industry!”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFogg75
Reviews.Content: Booked again in October 2009 (Business Trip), based on a previous good experience in this Hotel in July 2009 (Personal Event Trip). What a terrible mistake... "PLUS" OF THIS HOTEL : _ Its location : good district, 5 minutes walk from Hyde Park, Lancaster Gate Metro Station, 10 minutes from Oxford Street; _ Its average price : 60 to a bit less than a 100 Pounds (good bargain in comparison with the high cost of Hotels in London); _ Recently Refurbished; _ Some Suites equipped like a mini-studio; _ Breakfast : good value for money. MINUS OF THIS HOTEL : _ Average size of rooms : were they designed according to UK Prison Cell Standards? _ Rooms based in the basement to be avoided (machinery noises a large part of the night + quite dark even during day time...); _ You must not suffer from claustrophobia if you plan in staying in one of their rooms. Some previous guests seemed to have suffered of a panic attack, judging by some scratches on the room walls... _ Technical Problems : shortage of water at peak time in the morning, right at the moment when you need to get ready for an important meeting; electricity breakdown during the night : alarm clock not working; ice in the freezer and fridge had melted, transforming my room in a Little Venice... _ Not designed for Business Activities : very old and not functioning internet connection. Based on the spots found on the carpet, one's may suppose that a Pigeon Message System is more likely to be found in this hotel... _ Some breakfast staff, obviously coming for another country than the UK, not understanding words such as "plate", "spoon", "cup", cleaning tables", "smiling", "being helpful"... _ Incompetent reception Staff : they allocated me a room where a lady was already staying. I felt a bit ashamed asking her if she had finished cleaning the room... When I had to go all the way down to reception a 2nd time because my 2nd room key was not working, the Reception Staff tried to charge me a 2nd time the price of the stay that I had already paid before even getting my room in the morning... _ Very narrow and unclean Bathroom. If you plan to prepare a PhD about the "Evolution of Pubic Hair over the centuries", please feel free to organize a work stay in this place... _ Bell Men : good luck to find one of them when you need them. While going to collect back our luggage, we surprisingly found one of them being busy watching what we assumed was an "exotic" movie, in one of the bedroom used as a Luggage room... PERSONAL OPINION ABOUT THIS HOTEL : If you fear being short of places to see and adventures to live in London, this is real the place to stay. Or otherwise, please feel free to recommend it to your enemies...

Reviews.Title: “Health & Safety Issues”
Reviews.Author: Fortunately
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paddington Court Rooms, managed by Best Western and across the street from the main hotel. There is no lift in the Paddington Court Rooms. One of the staff carried my heavy suitcase up 3 flights of stairs to our room. He had to stop one floor below our room as he could not get the lights to work on the last flight of stairs and it was very dark. He returned with another staff member, who helped him find our room in the dark and turned on the lights in the room so we could make our way up the still unlit stairs. The 2nd staff member tried to discourage my husband from going out for a bite to eat, saying he could order a take-away and have it delivered. My husband wanted to go out, however, and had problems finding our room again in the dark. When we left the next morning, 2 flights of stairs were unlit, with no outside lighting, and I wondered what would happen if there was a fire. The room was clean, although we had trouble getting hot water in the shower and the phone did not seem to work properly (I couldn't get any of the 5 lines to the hotel reception, etc, to work). I couldn't get the Internet access to work in the room on my laptop. The 2 computer terminals I tried in the main hotel had viruses and I could not access the web with these either. I wasn't the only person with health & safety concerns about this hotel. A woman in the lobby of the main hotel expressed concern that several baby buggys had been left in a main corridor that also served as an emergency exit. This hotel struck me as sorely neglected as far as maintenance is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: p0mpeychick
Reviews.Content: we are rewards members of the best western group so we were quite surprised on arrival at this one. the hotel foyer is very nice and spacious unlike the rooms! we were booked into a superior room which was certainly not superior! you couldn't have swung a cat round in there! the radiator cover was hanging off the wall and had a big hole in it and the bedspread was full of holes, we had a wonderful view of the paint peeling from the exterior walls to top it off, we even had a power cut-we renamed the hotel Fawlty Towers and we were waiting for Manuell to pop into our room at any time!! no bath robes were supplied but on the plus side, the bathroom floor was warm and that was the only good thing about the place! definately the worst Best Western we have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “A dream that came true.....”
Reviews.Author: Dilwar_H_Azad
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my appreciation for the superior service I have received on the 17th January 2010. The service that your team has provided me was very efficient and friendly. The room that I have received was extraordinary; it was more than what I have expected. You have shown true loyalty towards an old customer. My experience at Shaftesbury was very delightful and satisfying. As always, all of the staff at Shaftesbury was extremely cooperative. I must show my appreciation toward two in particular who worked exceptionally hard to make it success on our anniversary. This is Vinaiyak and Mubeen without your hard work and determination our anniversary would not have been a success. You have work remarkably hard and I want to take this opportunity to thank you for all of your encouragement and support.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: desperado143
Reviews.Content: good customer service ever had nice staff pleasant stay HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly wonderful and lovely”
Reviews.Author: galaxina500
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was part of a package that was provided to my husband free of charge so we expected the worst, and we booked ourselves into a "trendier" hotel for the rest of our stay while we were still in NYC. However, this hotel was SO much nicer, better designed, more comfortable and better situated than the so-called "boutique" hotel we deeply regretted moving. The room we had was very very spacious, with beautiful lighting and an amazing bathroom with a fancy, powerful shower. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable, with great soft cotton bedding and a fluffy warm comforter. EVERYTHING worked and the staff was friendly and accomodating. I have been to London many times, and I was not excited about staying in Paddington but again I was very pleasantly surprised. The area was full of quaint and tiny restaurants and cafes and some lovely pubs, very accessible to tubes and buses, and the proximity to Hyde Park was wonderful. For the price, this hotel is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service, Crappy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tiddeleboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November for 6 days and was absolutely appalled by the service I received, or rather didn't. The hotel staff seemed completely unconcerned with their guests, and if you went down to the front desk, they addressed you in their own time--usually after making you wait a bit. Any questions I asked of the staff had to be asked at least three times to get an answer, rather than a run-around. At one point I was using the computer in the lobby and overheard a guest coming to the front desk to complain. Upon being told that the manager was not around (after he had just spoken with said manager), the guest left angry. When the guest was out of earshot, the staff began badmouthing him. With me still in the lobby. My electronic room key went down 3 times during my stay, at regular two day intervals. The room itself (a kitchenette suite) was smaller than the two star hotel I had stayed at on Belgrave Road. The kitchenette was a microwave and minifridge fitted into a space that looked as though it normally would have contained a dresser or something for your clothes. The cabinet where I was supposed to put my clothes was wedged in so tightly between the wall and the end table next to the bed, that I could barely open it. The view outside my room made me feel as though I was in a prison. There was a glowing green light (I'm assuming that it was the fire alarm it was attached to) on the ceiling and a bright blue light on the bottom of the TV--neither one turned off. The glow from these lights was so bright I had trouble sleeping. As a travel agent, I will never recommend this hotel to any of my clients and instead suggest they go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL - DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: DUB777
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through Last Minute where I had booked and I quote ''Awesome Paddington Hotel Fab New Rooms - 4* - London''. I rang 2 days before our arrival to confirm that we were being allocated the new 4* rooms and they confirmed it. When we arrived they put us in extremely small old rooms that were completely unacceptable and certainly not what we had booked. When we complained at reception the guy was very unhelpful, couldn't look us in the eye and firstly told us that there were no 4* rooms, then let it slip that they had actually all been allocated. Extremely annoyed at this stage we asked to speak with the manager who was equally as unhelpful. She blamed it all on Last Minute saying that they did not have any rooms that were 4* (even though this is clearly advertised on their website). She said that our options were to either take different rooms (that were only slightly bigger in size and not much better at all) or to get a full refund. At that time of the day we have no option but to stay and they did offer us free breakfasts for the inconvenience. However, even the breakfasts were very disappointing, edible but certainly not worth paying for. Overall we were extremely disappointed with our stay and wish to warn anyone contemplating choosing this hotel to stay well away!! The staff all appear very unhappy also which I believe is only a reflection on a very poorly managed hotel. I suspect that what happened to us is a regular occurrence and the only way we can stop it is by letting people out there know. AVOID at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about this damn dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnnyDenmark
Reviews.Content: Full of bed bugs, if you like your life, honestly, spend a bit more and get a clean hotel, we were bitten by bed bugs 2 days in a row, and we just left the hotel immediately. the dirtiest hotel I have ever been in my life, terrible terrible terrible

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - good location”
Reviews.Author: JeddahPrincess
Reviews.Content: Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court London We stayed for 8 nights at this hotel located at 27 Devonshire Terrace, Paddington, London UK and enjoyed it. Rooms small, but nicely decorated and clean. Friendly staff. Good value for money and near Paddington tube station. We stayed in a club room on the 2nd floor. Breakfast = good english breakfast. There are a lot of Best Western Hotels in London, so make sure of the address of the hotel before you book, because reviews are misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, smart, clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garyb77
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice in the last month and have stayed at other Shaftesbury hotels in the area this year. Having spent most of my business travel staying in big top hotels outside of London this year I am a little spoilt. Finding a decent hotel for a decent price in London is hard work and this company have hit the right note with a fair mix of cheap rooms (for London) with smart, fashionable, modern, clean rooms. This hotel is in a great location very close to Paddington and Lancaster Gate tubes and handy for the bright lights of the west end and the parks. For the money you will have to relinquish any thought of large spacious rooms, they are a little on the tight side but as I am travelling alone and do not normally spend much time in the room this was not a problem for me. The rooms are modern, well kitted (tea, coffee, complimentary biscuits, an iron which is great for business travellers). Good television set and clean stylish bedding and free broadband (and its quick). The service is ok and far from the worst and again it is all reflected in the price (book via the Shaftesbury group website for great prices £75 for a deluxe double). The breakfast is fantastic for the money (the acid test for any in England is the sausages and bacon and they are good here and not the usual 'frozen' fair). There are a number of reviewers complaining of turning up with no room...check out the terms and conditions when booking as some prices do not guarantee a room at the hotel you have booked but you are then ferried to another of the groups hotels. There are about 10 in a 0.5 mile vacinity so not too far and they are all alike. I now use no other hotel chain when staying in London (and this is someone used to the Hiltons and Radissons of this world)

Reviews.Title: “THE WORSE HOTEL EVER !!! DOn't stay there !”
Reviews.Author: vn09
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE HOTEL EVER !! NEVER EVER stay in this hotel again. We booked the 2 rooms at this hotel in early Nov 2009, got their confirmation for all. Then after about 15 hours on the plane, we were all no energy to do to anything else ! We got to the hotel for the first check-in, and they said NO rooms for us ! THIS WAS THE WORSE THING HAPPENED TO US : - We got STOLEN right inside the reception area of this hotel : the bag with 700 USD cash, one laptop, one digital-camera inside the bag . The bag was put beside the 2 laddies in our group, while the 2 men dealing with the check-in problem. The camera in the hotel recorded everything, but don't know for what reason COULD NOT find out who did this !! We did report this case to the police in London. - Final treatment that we got from this hotel was that they sent us to other hotel, and still charged us for the first day of this hotel that we had never had any chance to stay ?!

Reviews.Title: “Book based on price only, there is no other recomendation”
Reviews.Author: UkSwiss
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed here 3 times, as I have been forced to by work. There is one positive thing in that the very, very small room are well decorated, and appointed. Otherwise expect poor service at check in, poor service at breakfast which isn't the best and difficulty in swinging a cat in your room. If I were booking this hotel I would do it as a single person onjy, and based on price. Also if you are fluent in polish or indian then you should be able to understand the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Warning do not stay in this hotel: bed bugs, booking mix up, rude staff, dark and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: VisitorfromIreland88
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a clean flashy reception area and a small bar with the same decor. However once beyond this point the hotel turned into a maze of tiny corridors with a strange smell and brown carpets, similar to a retirement home. The doors were all held open by fire extinguishers, hoovers left permanently in corridors, tatty door frames, ripped carpets. DEFINITELY not a 4 star. We walked up many stairs to get to the 3rd floor as the lift only went to the lower floors and when we finally reached our room with our suitcases in tow we realized that we had been given a twin room instead of a double room. So back we returned down the stairs and informed the man behind the desk politely and in a clam manner about the mix up.Only to be met with a rude response. Basically we were told that the hotel is very popular and we were lucky to even have a room (I am not joking these were his words!). He also said that the hotel had tried to contact all the people that this had happened to but the numbers had not been working (which did not sound very believable) Finally he agreed to giving us a twin room the following day. We stayed in the double room that night and it was TINY! Pretty much only space for a double bed which was so small I was afraid to turn as I might knock my friend off!! There was also a narrow corridor beside the bathroom (which actually was a nice bathroom , but tiny if you bent down in the shower you could get stuck). The next day we were moved to a new room and luckily the previously mentioned staff member was not on and the people on duty were much more accommodating. The new room was bigger but still dark and dingy apart from the bathroom as mentioned before. HOWEVER............ it was in this room that I was bitten by BED BUGS. I did not realize that this had happened to me until I had returned home as the bites appeared then (they can appear up to 9 days later). I had to hoover my whole room, mattress, bed frame, suitcase, all of the furniture, wash and dry everything that I had with me at a high heat in case any of these critters had returned with me but I was very lucky that they hadn't because they are a nightmare to get rid of. The bites have still not healed and are very itchy and I cannot believe that untop of everything else this happened to me. It is so disgusting. This hotel is certainly not deserving of its four star status.I just don't understand it. Four stars hotels in Ireland are a pleasure to stay in: clean, luxurious, friendly staff. I cannot believe how this can be a 4 star unless the rating system is completely different in England? Do you have to stay in a 5 star to get a clean bed??? and this hotel has so many bad reviews how does it get away with it????

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean and an amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BethStockholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days in what felt like a newly renovated room and found it to be very cozy and clean. There was a small kitchen facility complete with microwave ,Kettle & fridge, a full sized iron & ironing board. The bed was really really comfortable with lovely white bedsheets. The bathroom was very clean and had a bath and shower and was a good size. There was even in room internet access too. The only problem is I was given a basement room which had a slight 'basement smell' about it so had to leave the window open at night. Had I been given a room away from there I couldnt ask for anything better for the price. The breakfast was amazing. There was ham, cheeses, pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cereals, bread, and a gorgeous English full english. The best breakfast ever - totally delicious. Overall I had a perfect stay and would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Pretty sure I got bedbug bites there... best to avoid, I would say”
Reviews.Author: AramAram
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days with wife and daughter. The hotel room we were assigned seemed somewhat small (after some initial problems and rearrangement to get a room with a double and twin bed with the desk clerk, which was done quickly enough), though seemed clean enough. However, A few days following the return from my trip I started itching and realised (confirmed by my doctor) that I probably got bedbug bites, and my guess is they are from this hotel room: on three separate occasions we had found blood on the sheets, which we thought was an odd (if disgusting) oversight and asked them to change. However, I now realise that they were probably bites from our own bodies... Ugh! I must warn that I am yet not 100% sure of this, though it seems quite likely. The reception desk was almost always full of guests and the simplest request or question took a long time to answer, nor were the staff particularly receptive or accomodating. One particular incident drove my pregnant wife a bit nuts. We needed to change rooms halfway through our stay and were told to "pass by" the front desk to do so (so we thought it would be a technicality). The ordeal took an hour, and was far from pleasant, in which she spoke to three people (two did not seem to know quite what they were doing). She asked them to keep our room, but were asked to pay 1 1/2 the amount we had been paying for three days (they finally knocked the price down, but we still payed more). My wife also asked them, rather politely, if they could move a huge bouquet of flowers sitting right next to her on the reception desk because of the rather pungent smell, which was bothering her, and was told that she would get used to it, that "it would pass"... all in all, an unfortunate experience. Their breakfast was adequate. But the bug thing just killed it... and negative reviews here, which I mistakenly only looked up AFTER staying there, are confirmed wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for One, Crowded for 2”
Reviews.Author: CanadianWomanAbroad
Reviews.Content: Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court London 27 devonshire terrace. Becareful there are at least 3 other best westerns and shaftsbury hotels with similar names in the same area. This seems to be some kind of a combination of two hotel chains. I had room 211. we stayed for 4 nights (prepaid online) the room overlooked a big mechanical thing. on the bright side it had nobody overlooking us so we could keep the curtains open. The window opened, good thing because the room was so small that got really stuffy. The AC took along time to get the room comfortable. But then seemed to go artic and not turn off. In order for us to move around at night we had to close our suitcases and stand them up. Location of this hotel cant be beat! great access to paddington, hyde park, etc, First night we left an apple and an orange on the desk. The cleaning staff or somebody took the apple. Odd. good thing we locked our belongings in our suitcases during day. One of the pillows was feather. we are both allergic. we put it in the wardrobe and left a note asking cleaning staff to please leave it in the wardrobe when making up the room. they put it back in the bed. the next day we put it back in the closet and it disappeared. hotel breakfast was 11.95 if prebooked and 14.95 if not. we did not want to pay that and easily found several cafe's around the corner with breakfast for under 5 pounds. Paddington station was great for shops, cafes and the Mad Bishop and Bear has great food. The bathroom was small but perfectly formed. Nice products, ie: shower gel with ginger. Staff replaced towels even when we hung them up. The room was clean and didnt have any nasty bugs which I had heard was a problem in London. If you plan to spend alot of time in your room don't book this hotel. For a base in London it was great. THe hotel appears to have been recently renovated since the pictures seem to vary so much. The place I stayed in looked like the pictures taken by CBTBarcelona and asioto. The main bedroom portion of the room was 10' x 10'. Yes REALLY that small. We could rarely hear anyone else. Once in a while footsteps in the hall and on our last day someone tried to use the emergency exit at 6am and set off the alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Items Stolen From Room”
Reviews.Author: Tourist10010
Reviews.Content: Had jewellery stolen from the room while sightseeing. Had a lovely holiday until we stayed here. Very, very dissapointing as the last thing you would expect is to have precious personal items stolen from your room. Rooms are extremely small and had some sort of worms in the shower. Not recommended at all, rather have stayed at a bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Central London”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBoy'H'
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night following Coldplay gig at Wembley Stadium. Paid £97.75 inc. full english breakfast for two via Laterooms.com. Excellent base for both Wembley and Central London, Got upgraded to a suite across the road from the hotel - these rooms would be ideal for a longer stay as you also get kitchen facilities (e.g. sink, microwave and fridge). A double bed and a single, lovely new bathroom and a wide screen lcd tv. 7-8 mins walk to Paddington Station and plenty of places to eat locally. Would stay again, especially for Wembley which is around 25 mins on the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: MrWint1981
Reviews.Content: Last minute deal, cost me 59 a night in a single room booked via London Nights. Excellent, clean, tidy and in a quiet location. Bathroom was pokey but for the one night easy to live with. I would recommend this as if you are only looking for a comfy bed and clean surroundings you won't get much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again !!!”
Reviews.Author: Nafalle
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend away with my partner to London and expected to stay at a hotel which wouldnt cause us not to enjoy ourselves. How wrong could I have been !! On arrival we were shown to a room which was so tiny i couldnt have swung a Gerbil around in it less alone a cat. The bed was fitted into a space where you couldnt get round it, the decor was drab and dreary and the bathroom was so small you couldnt turn around in it. There was no hot water in the evening and in the morning when we woke up the lights in the room ddnt work. After complainig three times we were moved to a larger room but it still wasnt great . If you want something with a bit of comfort DONT STAY HERE !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: splash7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot near Paddington station and while not spectacular, I've stayed in worse. Stayed with my small daughter - at first we were given a room right next to the lift (419 - avoid if you can) which was unbearably noisy and very small - I asked at the desk if we could change and the desk clerk was very accommodating (they all had the jaded look like this had happened 100 times). Bathroom was updated but small - anyone other than average size would very seriously be unable to fit in the shower. Room, including blankets, sheets and towels, could do with an overhaul. Overall, don't think I'd go back but considering the price we paid (105 pounds per night) I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “A value for money hotel in london”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: We were given a tiny room at the basement of the opposite building of the main hotel. Trying to find our room in the hotel was a challenging task...it was like a maze!! And when you need to carry huge heavy luggages...it aint very pleasant...in the narrow corridor of the hotel. Glad to know the room was newly refurbished...and there was complimentary internet in the room(though we always have problems with the connection). The breakfast was so so...typical english bfast...but make sure you get there by 9.45am on weekday...else there's nothing much left to eat. The hotel staff was not very pleasant....in fact some were very arrogant. They should do something about their hospitality !

Reviews.Title: “Would def stay again”
Reviews.Author: RYSAMBO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paddington Court Rooms for 2 nights recently and have to say I was very pleasantly surprised going by some of the reviews. We were given a club room and I have to say I have never seen such a big bed in my life! Nice 32" plasma on the wall and all round general very good, clean facilities. Bar looked nice for quiet pre theatre type drink but didnt use it. Breakfast very good (once you get seated) and location is superb. 3 minutes walk to Paddington, 5-10 to Hyde Park. Would def stay here again when we go back to London

Reviews.Title: “an unfortuneate choice”
Reviews.Author: PaleGale
Reviews.Content: We stayed in February in 2005 in a "suite". The room was small and located in the basement. As a result there was no view, the room was chilly but managed to have black mould on the walls. There was a tiny shower stall in the bathroom and a light fixture held in place by wads of toilet paper. Our complaints fell on deaf ears. Later we were promised a free stay in a better room if booked within a year. In February 2006 we attempted to have that promise honored with no success. The hotel refused to honor the promise of the manager as he was no longer with the hotel. To compound matters, they appeared to have lost our proof of payment and billed my credit card. I was able to successfully prove we had paid and the charges were withdrawn without benefit of an apology from the hotel. A great location but the amenities, service and commitment to their customers is sadly lacking. It has been some time since we were there but the reviews indicate many of the same problems exist.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a romantic stay in January '09. The reception staff were pleasant and we were given our room key. The room was very small (not much bigger than the double bed) but it was well furnished with quality furnishings. The bathroom was also quite small but, it, too, was fine. The hotel is reasonably well located a short distance from Paddington Station, with plenty of small local restaurants nearby. Breakfast was good. Overall, a decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Right in centre of London”
Reviews.Author: PrashantS
Reviews.Content: Right in the centre of London.. walking distance from Paddington station which is well connceted to Heathrow airport & all small & major stations in London/UK. For internation traveller this is nice place for dinning around & for some shopping. But the hotel is little cozy (standard rooms) & staff service are pretty normal. Food quality is ok & you can enjoy this place if you have to travel multiple places in UK/London

Reviews.Title: “Rather Good Actually”
Reviews.Author: Upnleave
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a little hell hole when I booked this hotel for a price of £67 for a double room including full English breakfast ( the hotel website offered better deals than the usual Lastminute , Expedia websites). The location was ok and quite central although you have to walk about a mile I think to get to the nearest Tube station (Paddington). The exterior was not very appealing so I thought well it's only for 1 night ... The receptionists and staff were all foreign and extremely hospitable and pleasant and as I arrived about 6 pm I got a free upgrade to a "club room"...It was a twin room and as I had booked a double the efficient housekeep quickly made up the room into a large double room The room was an ok size for London Hotels...( remember NY hotels are usually even smaller!) The room was clean, the linen clean and the flat-screen tv worked well. The complimentary food included an apple , orange and nice biscuits, tea, coffee, The fridge however did not work and the promised free 2 bottles of water were not there! The bathroom was reasonably clean too and quite spacious. The hotel has a small restaurant and bar which I didn't sample and has a gym too ( which I didn't visit). There was free high speed internet which I didn't use. The full English breakfast buffet also included a continental choice and of course the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a very pleasant experience and super price...I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: njfirstvisit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel, when i arrived early my room was ready. The rooms are pretty small but so is most things in London. The hotel is under renovations and i was lucky to get a renovated room (single), close to the elevators. if you are looking to stay in your room all day it might be too small, for someone who is mostly out , it was ok..It is very close to the Paddington station walking took me 5-10 minutes. My A/C did not work and some came up right away to fix, forgot to have iron/board in room which was brought right to me. the free internet was great. Be very careful of phone charges... I would stay here again when i return. Great price!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: suzaroo
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel on line and got a special rate - 391 pounds for five days. Our room was "tiny" and we are big people. The bed was full size and although it was okay comfort wise it didn't have fitted sheets. The plasma television and free internet service were good features. The bath had a corner shower that was very difficult for us to get in and out. Our room (413) overlooks Devonshire Terrace which gave us something interesting to look at. Tea and coffee making items were in the room which we utilized several times each day. It is only a 5 minute walk to Paddington bus service and the underground. Lots of shops and restaurants virtually on the doorstep. The Chelsea Deli was especially good with delicious latte and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Effelroy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and the room was extremely small. There were two twin beds with no walking space in the room and the bathroom was tiny with a small shower. The bathroom could barely fit a person in there without hitting the wall. The customer service at the reception was terrible because we asked several times to fix the TV remote control. The reception never send anyone to fix our TV remote control, so we couldn't watch TV at all for 3 days. We set up a wake up alarm call for 6 am and the wake up call was 30 minutes late at 6:30am. I brought my own alarm clock and that was a good thing. On our 3rd day at the hotel, we found a new bag of cookies was taken out of the luggage by the hotel staff and they put the cookies on the table. The hotel staff opened and ate the cookies. We were shocked that the hotel staff went through our luggage and reported the unacceptable behavior to the reception at the front desk. The hotel was very defensive and rude when we told them their staff went through our luggage and took cookies out. The hotel said there was nothing they could do made us very upset. They at least could apologize for the staff behavior.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Underground and Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: cwood493
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel, very close to Hyde Park (a short walk). Rooms were okay, but fridge was busted and cupboards seemed to need a bit of a fix. Elevator was not worth the risk of riding in. Good place to sleep after a busy day though. The lounge downstairs in nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: BabyRoo44
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our room wasnt ready but we were able to leave our luggage with the receptionist. Its close to the train station and tube stations which was handy. When we got into our room, which was tiny and very difficult to find, the only upside was that the bed was big and comfy! The bathroom was very small too. I struggled to get into the shower unit and shut the door, so I couldnt imagine Rik Waller staying at this hotel....... Sorry! Also, when on the loo I could see right into someone elses room, which was also their toilet.. Not good. Overall, was a nice stay, comfy bed but wouldnt be able to stay longer than 1 night..

Reviews.Title: “Poor overall”
Reviews.Author: Brunswick12
Reviews.Content: The generally possitive reviews and good price were what made me choose this hotel in the first place. The reviews were wrong and I suggest you heed my advice. I paid extra to get a deluxe room but there was nothing deluxe about what I was given. The cons are as follows: Star rating: The hotel sells itself as a 4 star and in the past I have experienced many hotels ranging from 2 to 5 star. Of the 4 star rated hotels I have experienced they have all been reasonably good and often provide you with the comfort and quality of a 5 star with slightly inferior finishing and fewer facilities. In this case however the hotel would more realistically be categorised as a mediocre 3 star. On this ground I was disappointed as the Shaftesbury did not live up to the standard you'd expect from a 4 star hotel in any sense of the term. State of room: The room was in the basement floor. There was marginal natural lighting and you had no view. There was something resembling a sky light that was apparently what made the room habitable. The carpets were a disgrace, there were marks all over them, they were worn, stained and grubby looking. The television remote did not work, except to change channel but no volume control or standby function worked. The room was stuffy due to poor ventilation and no window you could reach to open. The crockery for the complimentary tea was mismatched. The complimentary soap in the shower was empty. The minibar smelled like farts (seriously it did) and there was nothing in it except two lonely bottles of water. The safe was locked and could not be opened to store valuables in. The shower did not have adequate water guards and water would splash off you onto the toilet and toilet floor. Staff: with the exception of one receptionist they were indifferent to you, would not greet you as you entered the rather intimate lobby and would barely acknowledge you upon approaching their counter. They were not overtly rude but they were falling far short of the standard you would expect from a so called 4 star hotel's staff. Overall condition: The hotel had the fascade of style but it was cheaply done and already there were signs of detiroration from the marked up walls in the corridor to the disgraceful state of the room we were allocated. Facilities: The gym was a glorified home gym with very few machines. The lack of space or windows was also oppressive. i did not use any other facility but there didn't appear to be many in any event. There was no lift down to the basement level which meant we had to carry our luggage down/up on check-in and check out. I could have used the porter but chose not to. The point remains that the Shaftesbury is allocating rooms in it's basement that lack sufficient natural light, a lift and proper ventilation. All in all it was tacky, tired, psuedo-stylish, poorly kept, poorly presented, poorly attended and just generally rubbish. The only good points were its location and selection of television channels. However, these are not selling points as the area is full of similarly convenient hotels at a lower price and of a similar quality. Why should I pay extra for a 4 star that doesn't deliver when I could save the bulls**t and get a more honest 3 star for less money?

Reviews.Title: “awfull beware this place was disgusting”
Reviews.Author: lilli67
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a basement room across from the main hotel the room was so tiny, the bed was hard and dirty and the bathroom was filthy. We didnt get much sleep all night as there was some sort of courtyard outside our room and people were using it to smoke in through the night . On checking out we complained to the staff on the front desk who just gave us blank expressions as if we were talking to a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, more than just a B&B!”
Reviews.Author: Kay_Photog
Reviews.Content: I'm quite confused at the many negative reviews on this hotel, it's lovely for the prices offered, a lot cheaper than expected. It's a lot more "luxury" standard than a £114 a night TravelInn. I arrived at the hotel alone (met up with spouse later), to check-in to a busy reception area and checked in within a few minutes, the reception staff were lovely. I was annoyed as the porter showed me to my room along many corridors, up several flights up stairs without helping me with either my heavy suitcase or rucksake - rude! I made it to my room and the porter showed me in...single? Looooong trek back to reception!! They quickly changed my room no problems and with much apology. Looooong trek to room again, carrying bags on my own! The rooms are quite posh, lovely little shower room, TV welcoming on arrival and complimentary iron and board. The rooms are small but do the job. The only complaint with the room itself would be the view from the window overlooking lanes and yards. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to Paddington, and the area is much safer than dodgy King's Cross where you'd pay the same as you pay for this hotel but get a terrible 1* b&b. Just booked up for another stay here in a few months!

Reviews.Title: “'Nice area, had a lovely break away'”
Reviews.Author: Shameless3
Reviews.Content: My partner got me the weekend break for my 30th birthday 24-26 January so was really looking forward to it. I rang the hotel before we set off to make sure we had a room booked and breakfast was included as we booked over the internet. Everything was fine and i asked if we could leave our case with them as soon as we got there, as our train was at 5.30am, so we reached London way before check in time at 2pm, so that was really good for us. Travel was spot on and managed to find the hotel within minutes. No problems on checking in and the staff were polite and pleasant. Used the lift to the third floor and found our room. Very clean, modern, just as the pictures show on their website. Very small but most places are in London, but we were out all the time so it made no difference to us, we only wanted somewhere to put our heads. The only thing that made us laugh was the floor not being totally level so dont put a drink on the bedside table or it would soon hit the floor. Managed to level it out with my paper haha Shower wasnt very powerful but we managed, no problems with the water. The only downside to this hotel is the breakfast - nice but not warm at all, and it was a shame cos if the plates had been warmed through it would have been most enjoyable, good selection. The location was fine and close enough to tubes so we managed to get about all over the place. Only bad thing at the moment is the roadworks close to the hotel. Didn't affect us as we were up and out, but if you want a lie in, forget it and it seems like they will be there for quite some time yet! Views from our room wasnt anything to shout about - builders and more builders working below! We had no problems checking out, we were treated very well. Overall i would recommend it for anyone that is in London for a break, and we would visit again if we were in the area. Some reviews i think are over the top and wrong - we never experienced any bad feelings.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average hotel in an above average location”
Reviews.Author: nikhilganju
Reviews.Content: As if landing in London on the coldest weekend in years wasnt enough, there was nothing to warm or cheer us up about this dreary little hotel in the heart of London. Agreed, its not meant to be an exclusive hotel, but its not meant to be exclusively average either! They first checked me into Room 30, which is, truth be told, no more than a small hole carved into the wall, I've seen bathrooms and closets larger than that room! I obviously requested for a room change quite firmly, something they gave in to and gave me a slighly larger room across the street. The Air conditioning wasnt functioning properly upon entry as well as a couple of power plugs. Its clear that the hotel isnt too bothered about maintenance. Its good that we werent there for more than 2 nights before shifting into another hotel. To summarise, this hotel is a very basic place without great service. Its about a 10 min walk from the paddington underground from where you can of course quickly get to lots of places in the heart of london. If you have a choice of a hotel, avoid this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janelle_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nights.Great location. We caught the train to Paddington station and found the hotel easily and only a short walking distance.You can catch the Big Bus Tour just a few streets away..Also a choice of places to eat nearby. Staff were friendly and always helpful.Rooms are small but we were told to expect this in London.Plus we were only in our rooms to sleep as we were too busy sightseeing in the day. Our room had everything we needed and a great TV.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience and Theft!”
Reviews.Author: Bizkit10
Reviews.Content: The heating in our first room didn't work, and only after having demanded to move rooms twice, did they give us another room. The staff (predominantly Eastern European) aren't very friendly and having returned after a late Saturday night out, we entered our room to discover that a member of staff had gone through our things and stolen cash and personal items. We immediately went down to the reception to inform them and the police were already there. About 4 other rooms had also been rummaged through and things stolen such as laptops etc. Alarmingly, we were told by the police that this happened two months ago and it was a member of staff who had done this as they found all the stolen items in one of the spare hotel rooms. There are no CCTV cameras anywhere and any old stranger can walk into the hotel. Stay away if you value your things and want to enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTourist09
Reviews.Content: Not all rooms are refurbished. We got a room that was quite bad, the tv didn't even work. Make sure you get breakfast included in your booking. They changed us to a different room after we complained three times. This location is not ideal to downtown. Victoria is a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy staff”
Reviews.Author: CherryC
Reviews.Content: As others have stated the rooms and bathroom are small and suffer from design flaws, but not so much that it should be a problem. Room was comfortable, clean, everything worked if on the small side (not so small by London standards just could have been laid out better really). However I found the majority of the staff friendly but found one or two very creepy, and got the very distinct impression that the guy who looks after the luggage was making a personal comment about my appearance to someone else in whatever language they were speaking, causing them to eye me in a way I found extremely discomforting. Frankly, I don't expect that sort of behaviour from hotel front of staff, I found it creepy and uncomfortable to be around them - I popped to the shop across the road to buy milk and this guy was outside giving me funny looks then too. It's a shame because it is relatively low cost and convenient, I'd have stayed there again as a good hop on and off point for the Heathrow Express from Paddington. However ... no thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but comfortable & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Daicaregos
Reviews.Content: We arrived several hours before check in. The friendly staff were more than happy to look after our bags while we went to our business meeting. Checked in later, retrieving our luggage with no fuss - and all done with a smile. The room (on the 3rd floor, but the lift worked) was smaller than expected - almost no room between the foot of the bed and the wall - but everything was clean, including the en suite, and the bed comfortable. There was plenty of hot water, the TV reception was fine, the room temperature just right and the buffet style English breakfast (as much as you wanted) was average to good. Hotel rooms in central London are expensive (the Paddington Court Hotel is less than 5 minutes flat walk from Paddington station), so the price represents good value. The location was great - just minutes walk to Hyde Park & with superb public transport links (train, tube & bus) from Paddington - it felt like a very safe area and there were decent restaurants and cafes nearby. All in all the hotel is a good, comfortable base for a short stay in London. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: JBMaryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel includes a few different buildings and is a bit confusing. The rooms in the building with the front desk are much nicer than the rooms in the building across the street. This may explain why some reviewers were very happy with their rooms and others hated theirs. The guests in the nice building probably have no idea that the building across the street even exists. I reserved what was supposed to be a 4 star room for what was supposed to be a greatly discounted $139 pounds per night (plus an additional $20 pounds tax). Like many others staying in this area, we had an early flight out of Heathrow and wanted to be close to Paddington station. We checked in, and to reach our room, were directed to a completely different building across the street. The building was musty, our room was in the basement, the room had a damp smell, and there were stains on the walls. It was so small that we could barely move. There was no space for the (stained!) ironing board, so it was propped up against a wall. For $70 pounds a night, we probably would have stayed, but this was definitely not a 4 star hotel, definitely not worth $159 pounds/night. The elevator that had taken us down to the basement would not take us back up, so we had to drag our bags up the stairs, then walk back to the front desk to complain about the room. We were told that the hotel was booked, but when we refused our room, were shown another room. This one was slightly less musty, but not a whole lot better, definitely not 4 star. The bellhop who showed us these rooms said that every time guests received rooms across the street, they complained. "Every time!" he said, shaking his head. We refused this second room as well, and were eventually shown a room in 27 Devonshire Ter, the building that the front desk is in. This was a perfectly acceptable room, probably the 4 star room that we had reserved to begin with, but we were so upset by our treatment that we left. There are a number of budget hotels in the area, and we picked the first one we found, the Lawrence Hall Hotel, for $85 pounds/night (including tax and breakfast). It had the feel of a youth hostel, but our room was spacious and we were treated well. If you're lucky enough to get a room in 27 Devonshire, you may very well be happy with your room, but if you get a room across the street, beware. Or at least be willing to complain, as it's quite likely that you can negotiate a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cosy!”
Reviews.Author: NichyGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my son (13) in October of this year. The website reviews said they rooms were small and they weren't kidding! Our first room was so wee one of the single beds had no view of the TV at all but they were happy to move us. The next room we both had a view of the TV but there was no room to get round the chair at the bottom of the bed and you had to jump over it to get to the window. Apart from the size of the rooms the hotel rooms were clean and the staff were very nice and helpful and offered to print off boarding cards for us on departure. Great location for Paddington Station and it felt like quite a safe area to be in with a child at night.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: marghen
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reports we were quite worried about what to expect, but thankfully were suprised! On arrival we were told we had been upgraded to a Club room. The room was quite small but big enough for the time spent in it. Yes, the shower and bathroom were really small, but everything was spotlessly clean and new, towels changed every day and complimentary toiletries. The bed was a normal double size, clean and not at all worn or shabby. There wasn't much space to move around in the room, but who cares when all you really do is sleep and get changed etc. The staff were so friendly and polite, the breakfast was good with lots of choice and there were left luggae facilities which was really useful. The really only negative point was that it was absolutely BOILING in the room! Thanks good ness there was an air conditioning unit which helped! Maybe we were lucky with the room we were given??? The area is fantastic with lots of nice pubs and restarants withing walking distance. A great Indian beside the Victoria pub and a fantastic Greek restaurant on Leinister place - the small restaurant not the huge empty one! Have a good trip if you're going soon!

Reviews.Title: “What facilities?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Tam_Tamster
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a "Top Secret Hotel" on the LastMinute site. When I'd looked at these before I think I'd managed to work out one or two of the hotels and they looked good, so I thought why not try it this time. It wasn't quite the loaction I wanted but neither was it too inconvenient, so not too bad there. The lobby seemed okay too, although the person checking me in seemed more concerned with the person he picked up the phone to half way through checking me in - so rude! I was told that my room was down one floor. i double checked...down one floor? Yes, apparently that was the case. The explanation? It's a clubroom...whatever that was supposed to mean. Hey, maybe it means it's big enough to hire out for events and stuff? No, unfortunately not...it was pretty small. And being in the basement you had the feeling that a) it wasn't secure, and b) people were looking down on you from street level. It also suffered from lack of light, although the big wondow did go some way to remedying that. Shame the catch on it wasn't secure. I didn't feel happy leaving my stuff in the room to go out and get some food. And wasn't hugely happy about sleeping in the room either for that matter! Oh well, maybe I'll just stay in my room for the evening and use the facilities. Mini bar first...totally empty. So it looks like I'll have to go out and get some stuff to eat and drink after all. Oh well, I can at least browse the web first. No...that didn't work either. Fine I'll just go out now, get some food, come back and watch a film. Nope...movies weren't working either. Great! My only other real gripe about the room was the bathroom. It was very small, although that was less annoying than the fancy sink/tap combo. I've had one of those free standing sinks myself so know they're more form over function, but this one had a water spout that protruded out of the wall almost entirely over the sink, so wetting your face to shave, cleaning your teeth, whatever, it was a pain to use and ended up with water all over the place. Breakfast was okay and the dining room staff were friendly enough, although i was put on a table and then told to help myself at the buffet, only to come back to my table to find they'd subsequently also sat someone else there. *sigh* Won't be going back, and probably won't use LastMinute's Top Secret Hotels again either, although I have heard people having good experiences from them. I prefer to know where I'll be bad sink setup

Reviews.Title: “Had A Comfortable Stay After A Small Hitch”
Reviews.Author: ISHANIKA
Reviews.Content: .We had gone to London on an official tour and had taken a 5 nights stay in Paddington Courts and suites After reading reviews about the small size of the rooms at Paddington we were really nervous about our fate. The first good thing which happened to us was an amazingly early check in ( 8:30 am). The first room that we got was very tiny.In fact my husbands legs dangled out of the bed a good 11/2 feet ! And if he were to sleep on the bed I would have to sleep on the floor..never mind the fact that if I slept on the floor the luggage would have no place to go !! Luckily the AC in the room wasnt working and we requested the staff to change our room. A nice fellow at the hotel took pity on us and whoa..we got a decent sized room with a complimentry fruit basket to boot.After this we had a very smooth sailing 5 nights.Breakfast was good but the menu was more or less the same everyday !! All in all it was a comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean, tidy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Merrykins
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Paddington Court Suites, and although the rooms were very small (barely cat-swinging territory) they were very clean and comfortable. The way we saw it was that we were in London, so we wouldn't be spending that much time in the room anyway. The bathroom smelt of sewerage a bit, and we had to keep the bathroom door closed all the time, but we came across that a few times in London, so it's probably more to do with the old sewerage pipes than anything else. With the door closed we didn't notice anything. We had no problems with service and the cost was reasonable, for a location so close to town. I would recommend it to others, and stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: boyce5Antrim
Reviews.Content: We knew not to expect large rooms in central London but this hotel had the smallest room, bed and en suite i have ever stayed in! The shower was so small that it was difficult to wash in as i kept hitting my elbow of the wall. The toilet was through an arch way which was exactly the same width as myself. The worst part was the extremely small double bed, my husband and i are of average build and we found that we had hardly enough room to turn, very uncomfortable! We could only access the bed from one side which was a nuisance. We travelled with our son and daughter who had a twin room which was slightly better but when they came into our room in was standing room only. I was glad we were only staying 3 nights. Apart from the above problems the room was clean with lovely fluffy towels and toiletries and staff were friendly. We did not eat in so cannot comment on the food. It is only 5mins walk to Paddington underground and was in a nice quiet area of London.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: ness2007
Reviews.Content: the reception guys are adorable, helpful, there for you the rooms are more than good, bathroom too well located nest time i'll come there!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigerJB
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Best Western Shaftsbury Paddington for 4 nights as I was working in London for a total of £255 which is good value for money. The hotel is clean and tidy, the first room we had was victim to some ants, don't know where they came from. But we had been victim to heavy rain. The hotel without reservation gave us a choice of rooms to move to and we obviously picked which was the best.
